1.content:
Humans of Nuderia are spread all across the land and, like most fantasy humans strong willed, brave, and come in a variety of personalities. Most human civilizations view nudity as shameful and practice modesty, believing the human form to be weak and vulnerable. But there are still a few who embrace their natural form.

Orcs of Nuderia live in the scorched desert, unlike most counterparts aren't raving ugly brutes. True, they are much large than the other species, standing over eight feet tall, with both genders being naturally muscled, and they are green skinned with a pair of viscous lower fangs...aside from that Orcs are quite appealing and very well endowed. Male Orcs have members that large and thick (anybody under ten inches is considered small), and female orcs have massive breasts that, while odd still remained proportionate to their muscles bodies. Because of this Orcs are known for ferocious sexual appetites, and also tend to toss modesty aside as they believe anyone who willing covers up their sexual gifts to be shameful.

Elves of Nuderia are beautiful, perfect being who occupy the vast forests of the land. Always at one with nature, lower-ranking elves tend to go about naked simply because modesty is something they do not believe in. Higher ranking elves however are taught to wear majestic clothes designed to cover their bodies to the fullest and for an elven noble to shed them in public it is considered improper.

Other races also exist, but I'll let you decide who those are.

NOTE: The second "other" option will be locked until needed.
1.title: Start your quest...

11.content:
A brave choice. What role/class are you?

Peasant/commoner: An ordinary shmo living their life in a harsh world

Adventurer: A wandering hero who serves the land as they see fit

Criminal thief, murder, you live outside the law.

Noble A higher-ranking rich fellow

Royalty King, Queen, prince, or princess...the choice is yours
11.title: Human

1111.content:
Peasants are Peasants, no two ways about it, but what sort of peasant is our unfortunate young man going to be?

Is he a garden-variety commoner, living in a small village where he likely spends most of his days working, carrying out manual or menial labor? That is, when he's not dealing with the monsters, bandits, or mischievous spirits that a sparsely guarded small village might have to deal with.

Or is he a less peasant-ish peasant? One living in a city, likely a major landmark on Nuderia's map, who might study some higher craft. Of course, more important places might invite more dangerous company, and more complex studies could mean more opportunities to get oneself in trouble...

Perhaps more interestingly, he is still a normal human peasant... living in non-human lands. Among the elves, the orcs, whomever; be it through adoption, convenience, or a temporary arrangement, there's no denying that a human among non-humans has their work cut out for them. Culture shock is one thing, but it's a whole other matter when modesty is on the line.

So, who are we dealing with?
1111.title: Male

11111.content:
Jack was a simple boy.

Not in that he was slow, though he was definitely somewhat naive when it came to matters of the world. Nor was he entirely average in appearance- a handsome young man, of lean build, slightly above average high, and slightly above average "length" (though he hadn't had much occasion to share that fact.) No, what was simple was Jack's life, the life of a simple commoner in one of the small villages out on the long stretches of nothing that characterized human-inhabited Nuderia. The village had the fixings of any simple settlement- farmers, butchers, medicine man, and all the others in between. In a village of about 120, everyone knew everyone else in at least some capacity.

Jack was bored with all of it. The most exciting thing about the village was the forest out to the West, which would occasionally churn out a rowdy bunch of goblins, a gaggle of pesky fairies, a handful of simple-minded slimes, or some other low-threat but notable diversion. But even that hadn't happened for weeks; Jack was beginning to feel complete boredom set in, stuck in the rut of simple peasant's life as he was.

But little could he guess the excitement that was in store for him on that day of days, as he would be spending most of it....
11111.title: Villager

choices: Jack works at the Inn & Tavern.
111111.content:
As he clambered out of bed, Jack looked out the window. It was the same sight as always, illuminated by the same early light. His job demanded that he get up rather early... but where does he work?

The Farm is the simplest, most peasanty job for a peasant to have. Not very exciting, and very stuck in routine, Jack can at least take solace in one thing- the Forest. With the farm he works on the outskirts of town, its right next to the thick trees that form the west border of the village. Meaning, of course, that if any oddity makes its way out from the Forest into the village, he'll be the first to get a good look at it. Of course, that usually meant he was the first to have to deal with it as well...

On the other hand, the Inn was a good source of things to sate his curiosity of the outside world- traveling merchants, foreigners, even the occasional adventurer: all were endless fonts of knowledge about things Jack had never even heard of! Of course, foreigners could often bring strange customs, merchants could bring objects and relics that were more trouble than they were worth and adventurers could, well.... Adventurers could be very rowdy after a few drinks, and as the one usually bringing those drinks, Jack sometimes caught the brunt of that rowdiness.

Or perhaps some other facet of village life could be made more exciting for Jack today?
111111.title: In Town

choices: They wait, and Jack does something else.
A different creature/incident messes with Jack.
1111111.content:
"About time boy, hurry up!"
Jack let out a small groan as the farm owner, a cranky women named Methilda barked at him. The thirty-something widow had lost her husband to a pack of goblins two years ago and ever since then Jack had been doing all the farm work for her. He hated being a farm hand, and he hated Mathilda. What should be a strong-featured beauty always had her face crunched in a scowl, and he long dark hair seemed to be in a constantly state of duress as it danced around her fact, and overly modest grey dress that covered her entire body.
"The sun has barley risen." Jack said.
"And you should be here before the light is visible!" Mathilda snapped. "Now chop that wood, snap to it you lazy boy!"
I'll chop you, you sexually repressed bitch. Jack thought bitterly as he grabbed the wood axe and Mathilda went inside.
Jacks morning proceeded as normal, the sun rose and he chopped log after log while Mathilda scowled at him from her kitchen. Little did either know however that there were other guests at the farm, in the form of pixies.
The tiny, fairy-like creatures would, if you examined them closely look like human women, albeit naked, multi-colored and with butterfly wings. The male pixies were rarely seen and often regarded as recluses but the females are known of their mischief, powerful magic and a completely lack of understanding as to why humans wore the skin of animals and plants over their bodies.
This particular group of five, two-inch tall pixies were fluttering about outside the farm, and took a keen interest in Jack and those pair of unsightly brown leggings...
1111111.title: Jack is a Farmhand.

choices: The straightforward red pixie caused Jacks pants to start shrinking.
The tricky blue pixie started hypnotically whispering to him.
The clever yellow pixie stuck Jacks hands to the axe- as it stuck into the wood.
11111111.content:
Between the chopping of wood, the pounding of blood in his ears, and his own internally muttered curses at his employer, Jack couldn't hear the chittering and giggling of the technicolor trouble makers swiftly approaching. In addition, his tunnel vision and focus on his task kept him from looking over his shoulder and catching any of the five little blips of light darting in and out of the grass behind him. No, he had no idea what was in store for him...

To be fair, neither did the pixies. Chaotic little things by nature, they only knew what they wanted to do, not how they would do it or what the exact result would be. In fact, only one of the Fay mischief makers managed to cast the first spell. To the surprise of Jack and four of the pixies (and the delight of the latter)...
11111111.title: The pixies mess with Jack

choices: Methilda sees whats happening and comes running out.
His hands come free of the axe, but keep sticking to things he touches.
111111113.content:
The rhythm of chopping wood was familiar to Jack. Place log on chopping block, raise axe above your head and aim, and bring it down to chop the log in two. Place, raise, chop, place, raise, chop, over and over. Of course, the axe was far from new, and for Jack to sharpen it was only more work, so Jack was also no stranger to the axe sticking in the chopping block and throwing off the rhythm of the entire process. Muttering under his breath, Jack pulled and tugged and strained, but this axe was stuck much deeper and much tighter than he'd ever managed before.

"Come on you stupid thing... ah, forget it." Jack offered a final halfhearted try before deciding that he'd earned a break. However, when he went to let go of his axe, he found his hands unable to part with it.

"What the...?" He tried flexing his fingers, opening his hands, slipping them off the end of the axe; still, they stuck fast. Was it sap from one of the logs? Wouldn't think it could get this adhesive.

"Hehehe!" squeaked a high-pitch, bubbly voice from his shoulder. As the farmhand turned to look, his panic was mixed with confusion and wonder, as he found, glowing bright yellow against his drab working tunic, a pixie from the forest.

"Oh!" Jack momentarily forgot his predicament and just stared at the magical little lady. "You're a fairy, aren't you?" The pixie nodded her head. Jack chuckled, not believing his luck, before frowning, starting to piece things together. He nodded towards his hand on the hatchet. "This is, uh.... this one of your little 'tricks'?" Again, the fairy eagerly nodded her head, smiling wide as she looked behind Jack at the four other multi-colored balls of light floating up to him from within the grass. Oblivious, Jack tried to force a smile in return. "G-Good one! Really got me there." He paused for a moment, staring at the pixie expectantly.

An awkward silence passed, before Jack asked, "Do you... think you could unstick me now?" The fairy shook her head in denial. "Wh- listen, I really would like to get back to work now, so if you could just..." The yellow pixie blew a rasberry at him, as she fluttered down from his shoulder to stand on the immobile axe. "N-Now, listen to me, I need... you... too..." He trailed off, as he heard the giggling of additional pixies. Glancing around, he counted four more; a tall (for a pixie) Green on his left shoulder, a plump Purple on his right, a full-figured Blue that fluttered in front of his nose for a moment before flying off somewhere behind him, and a spry looking Red that hung upside down from above his head.

Before Jack even got to speak, the Yellow pixie snapped her fingers and the little women went into a frenzy. Sparkling trials of different color swirled around him as the pixies poked and prodded him. He could feel one pulling his hair, another working its way down the back of his shirt. Two more of them started climbing up his pant legs, and one of them - Yellow- kept floating in front of his face, making funny faces and provocative poses and then delighting in how red and worked up he got. All Jack was able to do was shake and struggle as he was assaulted, trying harder and harder to pull himself free, when suddenly...
111111113.title: The clever yellow pixie stuck Jacks hands to th...

choices: ...walks over to peek into the forest.
11111112.content:
A little while spent chopping logs, and Jack was interrupted as Mathilda came marching stiffly out of her house, coin-purse in hand.

"The market is opening in town. If I'm not there when it opens, those vultures in town will have bought up everything half-decent before I can even look through a single stall." She sniffed, and motioned to the now meager pile of wood Jack had yet to cut through. "I'll expect these to be chopped when I get back, and when you get through with them, you can start hoeing the field." Jack grimaced, but kept his mouth shut. Talking back just meant she'd stay longer to reprimand him, and he'd rather she left as soon as possible.

"Got all that? Good. Hop to it." Jack made a rude gesture as the woman turned, his eyes lingering downward as she walked away, before he chopped a few more pieces of wood.

Once he was fairly sure Mathilda was out of earshot, Jack tossed the axe to the side. As if he was going to work like this when he could sneak in a break! She'd take forever at the shops, like she always did, so Jack saw no problem in putting the chores off until later. It was too early, after all. Plenty of daylight left to do his work.

So, as a glittering group of fairies closed in behind him, no longer having to worry about a second pair of eyes, Jack...
11111112.title: They wait, and Jack does something else.

choices: They reveal their presence to Jack.
111111123.content:
Relieved to be able to take a break, Jack started to walk to the forest. He entered the woods and kept walking till he reached his destination, unaware of his followers.

In front of him, he now saw the clear blue water of the pool that he had discovered ages ago. This was his favourite place to unwind and relax, secluded and quiet, away from the hustle and bustle of daily life, and more importantly away from that woman Mathilda.

As he always did, Jack started to undress. The clear water was always warm and inviting, and he just couldn't resist taking a dip. As he stepped out of his trousers, Jack was unaware that this time, he had an audience.

The group of fairies watched closely, and they tried their best to stifle their giggles as they saw Jack pull his underwear down. They watched him from behind a rock, as he neatly folded his clothes and set them down. Jack then waded into the pool, and began to swim around.

The fairies waited till Jack had been swimming around for a while, before they set their plan into action.
111111123.title: ...walks over to peek into the forest.

choices: Keep watching and see what Jack does next.
Show themselves holding his clothes, hoping for a chase!
Give him his clothes back, but not before putting an enchantment on them...
1111111232.content:
The fairies waited until they saw Jack take a deep breath and submerge himself totally underwater before they flew over, darting through the reeds for fear that he might come back up for air. Two went and grabbed his shirt by the sleeves, dragging it away across the ground. Another three floated down and grabbed his pants, one for each leg and another which flew down one of the leg holes to come out the other side and grab the waistband. The final fairy, giggling all the while, crawled underneath his discarded drawers and lifted up, her purple light shining through the fabric as she drifted over to the other fairies to discard the garments.

Meanwhile, Jack surfaced, still blissfully bare and unaware of his audience. The clothes were curious to the fairies, but they were just bland, dead, dull skins. And yet, they were surely important to the human; why else, as he checked to position of the sun in the sky, sighing wistfully as he looked back towards the farm house, why did his expression drop so suddenly upon seeing his clothes missing? His eyes darted from right to left, his hands quickly shooting below the water to cover himself from what he could only imagine were thieves. Slowly, with one arm still covering himself, he started brushing through the reeds, hoping they'd just slid into the mud or something; it'd suck, but it wouldn't be the worst possibility.

The fairies, meanwhile, were doing all they could to bust out laughing, hidden in the trees as they were. They pondered what they could do now, if they would do anything at all-- this human was so interesting! Seeing what he would do next could be a treat on it's own, but ultimately they decided to....
1111111232.title: They steal his clothes.

1111112.content:
A common saying in Nuderia is "Those who wish to see excitement should look no further than the local tavern." A saying that in, Jacks experience was all too true.
Tonight alone he had seen the comings and going of all kinds of folk. Mages, Rogues, and Warriors adventuring across the land, priests and wizards on their pilgrimage, foreigners either venturing forth from their homeland, returning to it, and even some unsavory characters that Jack was all to glad to see leave. All things considered however, the night had not been to eventful. only two fights and broken loose and luckily Jack was not caught in the middle as the bartender/waiter normally was, most of the folk he met were friendly and even the shady looking characters never stayed long. Right now however, there were three particular tables of interest:

The first was a very large, very loud, and very naked Orc shouting and bellowing with his equally large and naked wife. Both of them were challenging random people to fights and the male Orc boasting about his rather distinctive member size ("THIRTEEN INCHES PUNY HUMAN, YOUR ENVY IS OBVIOUS!" ) his wife meanwhile kept giving Jack aside glances and her buxom, naked breasts on fully display made jack glad that his lower half was hidden by the bar.

The second was a table near the entrance that was occupied by a small group of female Gnomes talking rapidly in their language while fussing over some mechanical contraption that kept coughing steam. Jack wasn't sure what it was-Gnome inventions always baffled him-but at one point he could have sworn that one of the Gnomes (hidden by steam) let out a squeal and when the air cleared was wearing a dirty rob instead of the outfit she walked in with.

The third and final table was also the strangest and it had several half-naked people around it. The sole fully clothed occupant was a strange person with a bandaged head, heavy robes, heavy gloves, and heavy boots. The only part of them visible was a singe, bright blue eye peeking out from under their head coverings. Evening the Strangers gender was a mystery, and their voice was muffled by the bandages. All the night the stranger had been challenging people to poker and kept winning everything almost instantly, reducing five men and four (soon to be five) women to their skimpy underthings. Every time it got to that point the Stranger offered them a choice: one more hand to win everything or lose their modesty. So far nobody had taken that risk and now their was a group of strangers in their underwear waiting for somebody, anybody to take the risk and win all their clothes back.

Jack had just finished pouring the drinks and decided which table he would go to first...
1111112.title: Jack works at the Inn & Tavern.

choices: "An Alchemical Engine- it can change things into other substances."
"A Defense System - the smoke is supposed to dissolve non-living things."
11111122.content:
Compared to his other options, Jack felt like the gnomes were at the very least approachable. The shouting Orc was very big, very boisterous, and very naked, while his female companion was just as large and nude, and somehow more intimidating. The Stranger, on the other hand, was at least humanoid... but the growing pile of garments and growing crowd of players missing said garments was making him more than a little uncomfortable. The gnomes, while slightly inconsiderate with their smoke-belching machine, weren't likely to assault and/or strip him.

Right?

The three little women didn't actually seem to notice him at all until he put down the drinks, actually. Even then, the reaction wasn't what he was expecting- the second his tray clinked against the wooden tabletop, he was being shoved away by a small pair of hand on his leg. It was all he could do not to spill the drinks on himself, the floor, or the irate gnome in front of him.

"Upupup!" The gnome shook her head, and then slipped a pair of goggles off, wiping her brow, strands of her brown hair sticking to her sweaty forehead. The thick shirt, gloves, and trousers she was wearing made him slightly more uneasy about the machine, but not quite as uneasy as the screwdriver she was pointing at his face "Absolutely no volatile substances on the same surface as the machine." Jack was having a hard time not telling her off, considering it was his job to put the drinks on the tables, but he bit his tongue.

"...Sorry," he said after a second, playing the tray down on the next table over. "Is here fine?" he asked, slight edge to his voice.

"That's fine, hon," said a blond gnome, the one who was in the raggedy robe for some reason. Her goggles apparently survived whatever happened to her clothes, and as she took them off Jack saw a much more gentle disposition in her eyes. "Sorry about Lana. She gets antsy when she works."

"Look, Hanna, if the kid wants to have what happened to you happen to him, he can feel free, but I'm not getting caught up in it." The brunette gnome scowled, and glanced over to the redheaded gnome, kneeling on the table over the machine with her face hovering close up to it. "Ain't that right, Anna?" The redhead waved noncommittally, not looking up from her work. As Lana muttered to herself and stormed back over to the machine, Hannah walked over to Jack to grab her drink.

"Again, I'm really sorry about her, thank you very much....?"

"Jack," he replied, "and it's no problem. We've definitely had worse in here," he said, glancing over to the au naturale mountain of green on the other side of the room. The gnome stifled a giggle. "So, what are you working on, anyway?" Glancing over to the machine, Jack was feeling a little more curious than uneasy... until the machine sputtered and sparked again, coughing up another cloud of smoke.

"Oh, that little thing?" Hanna replied, "we've been working on that for a while, but it's still got a few kinks in it. It's..."
11111122.title: The Gnomes and their contraption

choices: Sat down across from the Stranger.
Declined the challenge, but continued to badmouth the stranger.
11111123.content:
Jack was just watching another game end, the fifth woman trembling as she removed her undershirt to reveal her underthings. The Stranger simply raked the garment in, making their usual offer to the woman, and when she got up after a moments hesitation, started to shuffle the deck of cards. He was startled out of spectating, almost spilling a tray of drinks, as a hand came to rest gently on his shoulder.

"They're still here, huh?" Gwen was Jack's boss at the tavern. She'd left to handle a dispute over one of the rooms upstairs in her usual stern-but-fair, and hand only just come back down. She was a pretty woman, if a little heavy set. With long red hair, freckles spread across her face, and a buxom chest, Jack often wound up staring at her a bit longer than was polite.

"Oh, yeah," Jack said, easing up. "Do you, uh, want me to send them out, or...?"

"No, no," Gwen waved Jack off, "whoever they are, they've been paying handsomely for drinks all night. I'm sure I'll get complaints from his opponents, but it's their collective arse on the line if they kept challenging him after the first three losers." Jack laughed, but still couldn't bring him to turn away, causing his boss to cock an eyebrow at him. "You're not thinking of challenging him, are you?"

"What? No, give me some credit, I know better than that."

Gwen nodded. "Smart boy."

This caused Jack to bristle. "What," he said, a defensive edge creeping into his voice, "you're so sure I'd lose?"

Gwen nodded again. "And I'd make you get right back to work once you did, no matter how you were dressed." This caused Jack to deflate a bit. Sure, he'd take risks, but the other losers could at least go home whenever they wanted. An embarrassing walk through town, yes, but a quick one with clothes at the end. Jack wasn't too far into his shift; if he had to do his job near-naked, or worse, he'd never hear the end of it from the regulars. A clap on his back brought him back down to Earth, as Gwen chuckled.

"That reigned you in a bit, eh?" she snickered, "We'll don't dwell too much on it. Like you said, you've got more sense than that, right?"

"Yeah, yeah," Jack muttered.

Gwen set a drink down on his tray. "Good, because you're bringing them their drink. Off you go!" Jack sighed as he came over to the table. There was the blacksmith, the bookseller, the baker, and a few other regulars, along with a group of hunters breezing through town. All of them stood fumbling to cover themselves as Jack came closer. The blacksmith and a few of the hunters took some drinks from his tray, but the others seemed to have lost any desire to make any worse decisions. Of course, the one Jack couldn't stop staring at, and the one whose single blue eye Jack seemed to catch as well, was the Stranger.

"Aha," they said, setting the thoroughly shuffled deck down onto the table, "I was wondering when you'd come by." They crooked a gloved finger, and Jack set a mug down in front of them. How the Stranger had been drinking them through the bandages Jack couldn't tell, but whenever anyone looked away the glass seemed to be a little bit more empty. Even muffled by the rags, Jack could hear the smirk creeping into the Stranger's voice. "So, boy, care to try your hand?"

"I- I think I'm alright," Jack said. The scantily clad crowd behind him huffed, but we're content to stay silent in their shame.

"Too bad. I haven't had a decent challenge in this town yet." The Strangers fingers played at the edge of the cards. "I suppose that's what I get for coming out to some backwater pub..."

That pulled Jack back in. "Hey now!" he said, "don't come in here thinking you get to act all high and mighty, just because you can win a card game. Doesn't make you better than us!"

"Makes me better at the card game, at the very least, doesn't it?" the Stranger pointed out as their fingers drummed the table, "And from there, it's not hard to say I'd be better at any other given thing requiring a sense of strategy, an understanding of rules..."

"Luck," Jack interrupted, and the Stranger chuckled.

"If that's all you think it is, boy, come on and prove me wrong. Or are you just another hick who can't help but run their mouth?"

Jack frowned, the tray of drinks and Gwen's warning nearly forgotten in the indignant anger bubbling in his head. He looked at the Stranger, at the crowd of victims around them, and finally, Jack...
11111123.title: The Stranger stripping everybody

choices: He stows away with some adventurers as they go through town in a wagon.
He's a blacksmith's apprentice, when a strange customer comes in...
A member of the royal family visits the village.
1111113.content: What other thing could happen to shake up the routine for Jack?
1111113.title: Jack does something else.

choices: He works for the local doctor, who needs a particular herb from the forest.
He's moving to the City for a more exciting life.
111112.content:
Jack was looking forward to today; he was finally getting to explore the Forest that had long-since enthralled him with fantastic (if mischievous) creatures and occurrences. It was not often that someone would willingly enter the Forest without an armed escort, or without a carriage or horse, or at the very least some knowledge of what the Forest held inside. Jack saw no need for such things- he was a capable young man, and could more than handle anything the Forest threw at him as he continued on his journey.

Though he was not an adventurer (yet, spoke a voice in the back of his mind), Jack liked to imagine himself on a Quest, through a dangerous dungeon. While that is perhaps overdoing it, it was true that he had a purpose as he delved further into the Woods--
111112.title: In the Forest

1112.content:
And finally, what kind of.peasant?

Rural Peasant, someone who lives out in the country, farming in the fields or working in the forests. These poor illiterate saps have to contend with monsters and bandits, often trying to buy them off in an effort to save their livelihoods from certain doom. Other times, problems require creative solutions, and keeping up their farm is more important than modesty.

Urban Peasant, this sod lives in the city, or a particularly large town, focusing on a craft or working for the city, rather than just slaving away in the country. Of course, with the city comes crime, and pickpockets and muggers are common where alleyways are plentiful ...

International Peasant, these guys are human peasants that live their lives outside of the human demesne, maybe an elf tree city, a dwarven hold, and Orc camp, or some other non-human locale. Or, an other-worlder, someone from another world finding themselves in a not-so-standard fantasy world, and trying to have a grand adventure, not dying in the process. Either way, cultural misunderstandings are going to happen.

So who to?
1112.title: Female

11123.content:
Interesting, so who are we going to follow?

We have the human surrounded by non-humans, trying to live their low-caste lot in life, trying to keep her clothes on amidst a foreign environment.

And we have the other-worlder, a poor comic-con fan who's found herself in Nuderia in nothing but her costume, and maybe some magical trickery or two if she was cosplayin a wizard/witch, trying to either find her way home, or explore the lands, who knows? Certainly not the poor sod we'll be writing about...
11123.title: International peasant

111232.content:
Alrighty then! For our victim ... I mean adventurer, we have two lovely ladies who happened to stumbled into a pucker-hole, an interdimensional tear in space time that bridges two separate universes for naught but a moment before closing back up. Of course, thanks to magic and such, their costumes dictate what happens to them, armor and weapons becoming real, staffs becoming magical, and not being able to read the local languages, or at least not the civilized ones (human, elf, dwarf).

Our first lovely misadventurer is Heidi. Dressed up as a wizard (standard robes and all), she now finds herself in Nuderia with magic that she doesn't understand, and can barely control. A more bookish personality, she's gonna take illiteracy pretty hard, not to mention that her underwear is gone, vaporized in the pucker-hole, all she's gotta do is hope that there isn't a stiff breeze. She's got black hair, a nice body, a little thin, but nice, somewhere between B and C cup, but a butt to die for, and keeps herself shaven down south.

Our second lovely lady is Amber. Dressed up as a standard fantasy female warrior, she's wearing nothing but a chainmail loincloth, a chainmail bikini top, sandals and shin guards, armored bracers, and a hair tie. She's considerably grumpy at her underwear getting vaporized as she fell through the pucker-hole, but at least she still has her greatsword. She's a brunette, curves that she was intentionally flaunting at comic-con, almost D-size, but not quite, a perfectly rounded bottom that's the only thing really keeping her loincloth chainmail from sliding off, and a considerable bush down below.

Who's it gonna be?
111232.title: Other-worlder

choices: a handsome sixty-five foot male giant
a ring of eighteen year old male wizardly apprentices
1112321.content:
"Disgusting," Heidi muttered, as a taller, bustier brunette walked by, wearing a chain mail bikini. Every mouth she passed seemed to drop, and every set of eyes tracked the chainmail clad cosplayer as she strode by.

"You could pull that off easily," Heidi's friend remarked. "Or any look, for that matter. Maybe an elven archer."

Heidi just humphed. "Not my thing. I like being Hedelkus the Shadowy Sorceress," Heidi continued, gesturing with the free hand not holding her staff at her robe clad body.

In truth, Heidi wore her robes because the twenty-year old was uncomfortable with her body. When she was a little girl, Heidi was on the chubby side, with long tangled hair. So now she exercised and dieted obsessively, to the point she was a little on the thin side, though her body was firm and trim. Her hair she kept in a bob style.

Her friend just shook her head sadly, knowing the poor self image Heidi had of herself.

Heidi also hated her name, thinking it invoked a blue eyed blond Austrian girl, not the olive skinned girl that Heidi saw every time sh looked into the mirror. 1121.content:
There's all kinds of adventurer's out there, so what kind is our unfortunate human guy going to be?

Warriors rely on physical strength more than anything, courageous and ready to take any fight! Of course, in the face of powerful magic, swinging a simple sword and relying on mundane armor doesn't always get the job done, and a prideful warrior can be prone to taking hard falls...

Mages, clad in their heavy robes, are masters of the forces behind the universe, bending reality to their will! Naturally, that sort of power can bring about an inflated ego, and an attitude like that doesn't help much when physical prowess is needed, leaving some mages in a pinch when they've expended all their spells.

Or something else, maybe?
1121.title: Male

11213.content:
Maybe he's a bard. A jack of all trades, master of very few, the bard is a great support to any team. Cunning, but falling behind both warriors and mages in terms of dealing damage, a bard doesn't do very well when alone in a face-to-face confrontation...

Or what about a cleric? Tapped into the Forces That Be, a cleric can be pure and good, or at least well meaning, and very powerful in a pinch. But, if the heavy, uncomfortable robes didn't give it away, intimate contact is not something they'd be used to. Those vows of purity have caused more than one naive young convert to fall victim to their own ability to fluster easily.

Or more ideas for who they could be?
11213.title: More choices.

1122.content:
They say a persons vocation says a lot about their personality. The same can be said for any adventurer, both in broad terms and for specific classes of adventurer. In a general sense, adventurer's tend to be very driven people, be it for fame, fortune, thrill, or family. They also tend to throw themselves eagerly into bad situations in such a way that others might call "insane". In more specific circumstances, however, you can usually look to how an adventurer carries out their job to find how they might act.

Fighters or Barbarians tend to be straightforward people, good with a sword, axe, or shield. Ranging from heavy armor (for the more conservative or careful fighters) to leather straps and scraps of hide (for the wilder, more barbaric warriors.) They can take a lot of punishment before slowing down, but their prideful nature can get them in trouble when facing tough enemies.

Wizards or Sorcerers are usually clad in heavy robes. Wielding powerful magics, they have a tendency to hold themselves haughtily above others. Their magic can be unpredictable, however, and their attitudes typically don't make them many friends. They can dish out a lot, but it doesn't take much to send them into a tizzy....

Rogues or Archers are fast, agile adventurers that use their speed and wits to outsmart enemies. Good in a pinch, and good at keeping cool, they tend to come up at a loss when in a face-to-face fair fight.

So, who is out unlucky young lady?

11221.content:
Kali was having a rough time of things, lately.

The brown-skinned gladiator hadn't landed a decent job in months. While people on were more than happy to recognize her- the cities in the area had come to know her as a mace-swinging powerhouse in the coliseums- few of them were either able or willing to toss a few coins her way. Now, it had been some time since she'd gotten decent pay, and her coliseum winnings and the occasional wage from heavy lifting were starting to dwindle.

Kali cut an intimidating figure, strolling into the town's center square. She was tall for a human, enough to give most elves a run for their money. The bare, slightly scarred muscles of her arms accentuated her shield nicely, as well as the mace she had slung over her shoulder in gloved hands. Her armor, for ease of movement, and so as to fit over her generous, muscled hips, was mostly leather, with metal plating around the torso and legs. Her head was unobstructed, letting the crowd see her solid, though not unattractive face, and the long, brown, braided ponytail that hung comfortably down to the middle of her back.

She had come for one purpose- the bulletin board. In many cities of a certain size or more, troubles came up frequently enough that, with the just as frequent traffic of adventurers through them, people could hang up job offers on such boards and be reasonably assured that someone, in time, would give them a hand. For the past few months though, things seemed just peachy, with the only job offers available being menial labor (which Kali often found herself taking, despite hungering for more excitement) or tasks with far, FAR less pay offered than what was being asked. It didn't matter if she needed the money, goblins were right little bastards and Kali wasn't about to go wading through a group of them for just 40 gold coins.

The combination of boredom, low pay, and lack of expectations made it all the more satisfying for Kali to find, smack in the middle of the board, a job that seemed.... actually decent? Tearing the flier off from the rest, a grin crossed her face. The job was paying enough that, at the very least, she could travel to a city with more need for an adventurer. She had to take it, even if it was something as inane as....

"Actually ma'am," Kali gave a short, but acceptably polite bow, "I'm Kali, your escort and guard for the journey."

The noblewoman looked appraisingly at Kali, taking in her heavily muscled and scarred arms, her suntanned skin, this woman looked more like a barbarian than an adventurer! And she'd never heard of a female adventurer before, maybe things were different outside the high kingdoms?

"Very well then...Kali was it? I am Dame Arionne, of the High Kingdom of Titsburgh, the City of the Twin Peaks." She gestured to the front of the carriage, Won't you please take your seat so that we may begin our journey?"

Kali nodded, joining the lady in the carriage and enjoying the ride, once out of the city, Kali tried to start up a conversation with the Dame.

Needless to say, the title of hero had gone to Vanessa's head, and her ego had grown considerably. Many elves were upset at her boasting, and challengers weren't uncommon. Vanessa had beaten every one so far, but a few had been more difficult to beat than Vanessa would readily admit.

It wasn't just elves Vanessa had to worry about. As a hero, she was still called upon to serve the kingdom when needed, and her reputation and honor demanded she answer the call. No ragtag brutes with no plan were going to be a problem, but it was the smart ones that could be dangerous.

Vanessa looked down, fire beginning to crackle on her fingertips to burn away the roots before realizing they were too tightly pressed against her to burn them safely. Grimacing, Vanessa tried to think of what to do as the roots started to disappear under the hem of her robes and a voice rang out from the ruined market stall.

"Leave it to a human to make assumptions based on appearances." came the elf's voice. Stepping out of the cloud of debris, the crowd could see that Vanessa's attack had blasted the plain brown cloak off, revealing the splendid gown beneath. "You saw a commoner's robe and wrote me off as nothing."

"Pft, you think this little surprise attack will save you?" Vanessa taunted. "It was clever enough, I'll grant you, but playtime is over!"

Vanessa stuck a hand out, willing lightning to shoot from her palm and incapacitate her opponent. When nothing happened, however, she frowned, confused.

"Surprised?" the elf, who Vanessa now remembered had called herself Auria, asked. "I'm not surprised. For all your bluster, you're terribly uninformed about the kind of nature knowledge any elf child could recite. Have you ever heard of Magebane?"

Vanessa paled. Magebane was a rare plant, resistant to magic and capable of nullifying a caster's abilities if exposed to it. But if these roots were supposed to be Magebane, how was Auria controlling them? That kind of power was... not something Vanessa wanted to consider.

"I see by your eyes that you have heard of it, and you seem to understand your predicament." Auria said, stepping closer. "It's scary, isn't it? Knowing your greatest tool has been taken from you, leaving you helpless and vulnerable."

"Okay, y-you've made your point!" Vanessa snapped, trying to mask her fear with anger. "Now accept your little victory and leave me alone!"

Auria's eyes narrowed, anger flashing in her golden irises. "You think this will satisfy me? After what you did to my sister?! You defeated her, shamed her, and left her tied up and on display for an entire city to see! Such an insult to my family will not stand!"

Her sister? Vanessa didn't know this woman, and she wasn't in the habit of asking her defeated opponents what their names were. In all honesty, the mage didn't recall who the sister in question might have been. But the elf before her clearly remembered, and clearly desired vengeance...

"If you were 22 you would've spent the last 5 years nude! Instead you look like you're body has never seen the sun!"

"Plus I've never seen a woman hiding her body like you are!" One of the girl's said, pointing at Dianna's hand's clutched over her body.

The lead girl looked up, seeing that they were in front of a bar.

"Oh, I see what's happening." The girl said.

"What?" One of the other's asked her.

"She thought maybe is she stripped down, acted like an adult she could sneak into the tavern!" They all laughed. "Like that would actually work!

All three laughed. Dianna stood, cheeks burning. Normally she had a lightning fast wit, but her tongue was slowed from embarrassment. She was horrified, being mistaken for a child. At the same time, if she pretended to be younger, she would get to wear clothes! Was it worth sacrificing her womanly pride for though?
112231222.title: Some teenage girl's approach... and they...

1132.content:
Like any land, Nuderia had its share of criminals to deal with. Some were nasty enough to warrant hiring adventurers to take care of, while others were small-time crooks just making a living. No matter their severity, there was no arguing they were on the wrong side of the law. In the realm, there were a few criminals of particular notoriety.

Mary of the Red, as she was known, fancied herself a heroic criminal. The crimson-haired beauty prided herself on her standards, making a point to only target the wealthy and arrogant of society and giving the better half of her loot to the less fortunate. It didn't seem right that nobles got to eat well and wear the finest fabrics while countless peasants went hungry and wore clothing little better than threadbare rags. Targeting the rich specifically was a surefire way to make powerful enemies, however.

"Silent" Selena, known only for the black armor that matched her inky black hair. Selena offered her services to those that could afford it, and knew how to contact her. Nobody knew much about the thief beyond the cant physical details already mentioned and her nefarious line of work. For the right price, Selena would destroy the reputation of anybody, most notably by stripping them bare and leaving them for all to see in some highly public area. Nobles, adventurers, peasants, nobody was beyond Selena's standards.

Cassandra Ironarm was far more fitting of the typical criminal persona than the previous two. Cassandra was a bandit, plain and simple; robbing caravans, extorting peasants, and dodging the law were all regular aspects of the woman's life. Her heavy axe was her weapon of choice, the wicked tool proving just as effective at intimidating people as hacking through armor. Bandits might enjoy prosperity and wealth for a time, but they all know that they can't get complacent- the law will do anything it can to bring such a notorious bandit to justice.
1132.title: Female

11321.content: If the quality of one's life can be measured by the enemies one makes, then Mary of the Red had led an incredible life indeed. Unfortunately, one of those enemies was about to make Mary's life a little less...palatable. In this case, the enemy was one Lance de Untestus, more commonly known as the young
11321.title: Mary of the Red

choices: Selena knows who the target is. (Nobility.)
The target is a stranger to Selena. (Non-Nobility)
11322.content:
The envelope must have passed through dozens of pairs of hands before it made it to her. She'd tracked it the whole way, of course, and if it really came from who she thought it was coming from, then Selena could already feel the gold coins between her fingers. The raven-haired "assassin" cradled the envelope for a moment, before pulling out a dagger to pop the intricate wax seal. Letting the parchment within unfold, Serena's hidden lips twisted into a smile behind her black helmet.

In exchange for the public humiliation of her target, she was being promised an exorbitant sum, with a few caveats. Can't be traced back to her employer, bloodshed must be kept to an absolute minimum, etc, etc. All very standard stuff.

What wasn't standard was the target. Selena had taken all sorts of contracts, and would of course take this one. She was a bit surprised at her target, but it wasn't about to stop her. It included their name, location, a short reason for requiring her services, and a bounty.
11322.title: "Silent" Selena

choices: The Queen herself, by one of her many enemies.
A young nobleman, by a fellow noble who feels insulted by him.
The Captain of the Royal Guard, by one of her ambitious subordinates.
113221.content: The target held a high position in the kingdom. This was going to be a hard job, but between the pay and personal satisfaction, Selena was raring to go. Most people in her line of work would kill for the opportunity that she had been presented, and here she was getting paid to humiliate...
113221.title: Selena knows who the target is. (Nobility.)

choices: As she slept in her barracks.
As she traveled away from the city.
As she guarded a ball at the Royal Palace.
1132213.content:
Selena could only guess at the identity of the person hiring her, but she had plenty of options to choose from. Captain Henrietta Reinhardt was a mountain of a woman, tall and rugged, and she was cold as any mountain's peak. With her keenly honed talents of combat and tactics, and her domineering nature, she rose quickly through the ranks of the Queen's Guard, eventually taking command of it. Under her iron grip, crime was rapidly declining, with a new wave of authority spreading out from the capital, only losing sway as it spread out to the edges of the kingdom.

Of course, not everyone was happy about this. Most bandits, thieves, and any other given group of ne'er-do-wells were all having to watch their step more than they'd like to have to. Selena included, though she was skilled enough that it wasn't more than an inconvenience, but she had no love for the Captain. Then of course were the common peasants and merchants, who in the past might have gotten away with a harmless bit of unsanctioned trading or gambling, but were now finding themselves subject to tariffs and fines. And of course, even among the Captain's immediate superiors and inferiors, there were doubtless people who had gotten sick of the woman, or who wanted to be where she was now.

All in all, it didn't matter who wanted the woman taken down a peg; Selena was happy to go about her job either way. But, she could take a certain amount of pleasure in knowing that many other people would be happy to see her job finished as well. All that mattered is how she would get the job done.

Would it be while the Captain was sleeping? The barracks would obviously be crawling with trained Guards, but if she could pull it off, Selena would be humiliating Reinhardt in front of her troops. Alternatively, she could wait for the Captain to leave the city on business. Outside the city walls, with only a handful of guards as escort, Selena would have a much easier time, and the client would undoubtedly be satisfied if she sent Henrietta running back into the city buck naked. Or, if she really wanted to make Reinhardt squirm, it was no secret that the woman was uncomfortable at the high society celebrations in the palace that she was obligated to attend as security. Selena wasn't opposed to giving any visiting nobles a good show, and it was a good opportunity to scope the place out for future reference.

Selena set about preparing herself for her mission- black, light armor, covering every inch of her skin, with an accompanying mask that covered everything but her hair. A number of knives, good for throwing, threatening, and everything in between. Rope, hooks, a smoke bomb or two, even a vial of sedative if it came down to that. All would be in order when she set out to humiliate Captain Reinhardt...
1132213.title: The Captain of the Royal Guard, by one of her a...

choices: Slip a sedative into a drink sent to the Captain.
Impersonate a servant, so she could get close without raising suspicion.
Impersonate a noble, and invite the Captain to a dance.
11322133.content:
The ball would be the perfect place to humiliate the captain, Selena decided. Other guards would be present, humiliating Reinhardt in front of her subordinates, the nobles present would be scandalized to the point that the captain might lose her job, and rumors of the night would trickle into the city proper for all the common folk to here. And that was assuming Selena didn't figure out a way to expose the captain to a wider audience than was guaranteed at the ball.

Sneaking into the ball itself was trivial, as it always was for an infiltrator of Selena's caliber. There were never enough guards to watch every vulnerability, and there were always windows in patrols where she could slip past without issue. A quick throw of a grappling hook saw Selena over the defensive wall, and another deft maneuver saw her sliding in through an unlocked window several floors up.

Even from the guest room Selena could hear the party. Music, mindless gossip among the gathered nobles, and the scurrying of serving staff all mingled into a dull roar that was easy enough to follow. Captain Reinhardt was exactly where Selena figured she'd be: by the Queen's side, prepared to defend her liege with her life. This was good; Reinhardt and the other guards were focused on protecting the Queen and guests, and would never have thought one of their own would need protection.

Now there was the question of how to go about enacting the captain's humiliation. Surveying the party from a shadowy vantage point, Selena devised a plan to-
11322133.title: As she guarded a ball at the Royal Palace.

choices: She changes and heads back out to the ballroom.
Someone walks in while she's changing.
113221332.content:
The assassin and the serving staff had a lot in common. Both needed to move deliberately from place to target to place, weaving through a variety of obstacles. Both needed to be able to predict the behavior of others, and be flexible when something unpredictable happened. Both needed to draw as little attention as possible, only showing themselves at crucial moments. There was a sort of unspoken kinship between Silena and the overworked waiters and waitresses that she could see running back and forth across the ballroom floor.

She almost felt sorry for the one who'd be giving her a disguise.

Going as a noble was too risky, too much potential for someone to recognize her as an impostor. And even with all of her skills, trying to approach the queen from any angle as she was would end badly for her; Reinhardt wasn't liked, but that didn't mean she was bad at her job. No, Reinhardt wouldn't be suspicious of a servant- at least, not more so than she was constantly of everyone.

With the demand of the job, it was only a matter of time before one of the servants needed a break. This one was easy enough to pick out; a lean young woman with red curly hair, beads of sweat visible on her brow. She'd nearly spilled a glass as she poured one of the patrons fresh wine. Silena watched the woman, visibly shaken from the close call, unsteadily make her way over to the kitchen. Silena silently slipped into a covered cart that passed by her vantage point, and in a few short moments she was right there behind her quarry.

Slipping out from under the cloth, Silena followed the redhead through a servants exit. Lucky for her, the girl didn't think to look back until she opened the door to a set of servant's quarters. But by then, even as green eyes widened and freckled cheeks stretched back to scream, Silena was upon her.

On a bed in the servant's quarters lie the unconscious body of the servant. Silena had tried to be as gentle as possible, but the girl was still going to wake up with a headache. Not to mention a chill...

Boots hit the floor, leggings were peeled off, tunic pulled over uncooperative arms. Silena even took off the girls underclothes, revealing two pink nubs and a bush of orange hair. If she woke up anytime soon, her nudity would discourage her from escaping- if the underwear-turned- gag & hogtie didn't keep her stuck in the nearby linen cart.

With disguise in hand, Silena started to change, knowing that she was already much closer to another successful job done...
113221332.title: Impersonate a servant, so she could get close w...

choices: Another noble demands Selena's service, refusing to hear otherwise.
Selena made it to Reinhardt without trouble. Now to slip her the drink...
Selena isn't the only infiltrator there tonight. Another makes a scene.
1132213321.content:
The servant's outfit wasn't a perfect fit on Selena's body. She'd been more focused on isolating a servant to steal an outfit from than she was on singling out a servant that matched her figure. The leggings were a little loose and the tunic was a bit snug, but it wasn't blatantly obvious that Selena was wearing clothing meant for somebody else. With an apologetic kiss on the forehead of the unconscious servant, Selena slipped back into the ballroom and assumed her role as a lowly servant.

Selena hated nobles, and her experience within minutes of being in the ballroom dressed as a servant only helped remind her why she hated them so much. The ladies were dismissive and rude, and the men were blatantly lecherous, seeing nothing wrong with copping a feel on the shapely "servant" as she made her way through the crowd. If this kept up, Selena was going to need to start a list of people that deserved payback once this was all over.

That could wait, the contract was far more important. Reinhardt was on the other side of the ballroom, her eyes scanning the crowd for any sign of danger to her Queen. Selena had her vial of sedative hidden up one of her sleeves, and it wouldn't be difficult to relieve a fellow servant of a drink tray. Then it would be a simple matter of spiking a drink and offering it to the dutiful captain. This would be child's play for a woman of Selena's skills.

It would be. As it was...
1132213321.title: She changes and heads back out to the ballroom.

choices: Selena incorporates the woman into her plan, and slips her the sedative.
Selena bears with the noblewoman, wanting to stick to her plan.
The noble woman takes the drink and douses Selena with it to humiliate her.
11322133211.content:
The tray of drinks that Selena had acquired nearly went clattering to the floor as Selena, moving determinedly towards her quarry, was stopped by a sharp tug at the back of her leggings.

"Excuse me," came a prim, shrill voice, "but I have been dying for refreshments since arriving in this god-forsaken ballroom, and not a one of you servants have even thought to offer me anything!"

With a deep breath, suppressing a wince or a scowl with every syllable spoken, Selena turned to address her latest impediment, doing her best to keep an apologetic apathy on her face. The woman who had stopped her was dressed in an elaborate dress, light purple with white trim, and a low cut bodice that showed off a generous amount of pale-skinned cleavage. If it wasn't for the amount of jewelry she was wearing, including am amethyst necklace that nearly dipped in between the woman's displayed breasts, one might call her trashy. As it was, she was gaudy and flashy- opulent enough to call her refined, if only barely restrained.

"I'm terribly sorry, your ladyship, but I--"

"You should be!" interrupted the woman. "Drab, lowly girl like you wouldn't even have those simpering clothes if it wasn't for my kingdom's textiles." Ah, Selena knew who she was dealing with now. This must have been a member of the ruling family in Baredeth, a neighboring kingdom whose chief export was in textiles, the unique plants and animals living there producing high quality silks and tough, sturdy wool alike. Of course, this couldn't have been the Queen, or the Princess- likely a niece of the Queen, or a sister-in-law to one of the Princesses. High status? Certainly. Importance to the kingdom? Most likely negligible. Selena had no doubt that she was looking at a spoiled brat sent to the party to fulfill some sort of obligation to keep the kingdoms' relationship strong.

"A-HEM," the Lady coughed. "My drink, s'il vous plaît?" Selena knew that her temper wouldn't last long, but Selena still needed to keep her own in check. Or... certainly, if something were to happen to dignitary of a foreign kingdom, something embarrassing that could damage relations, the Royal Guard would need to do something about it. If Selena slipped a bit of the sedative, escorted the suddenly dazed noble to a secluded room in a compromising position, and then informed the Captain that something was amiss, the captain would surely look into the matter herself to avoid publicizing the issue. Leaving the ballroom alone would open Reinhardt up to more options for Selena.

Of course, that might be over-complicating things. She'd been hired to humiliate one target, without letting her own feelings getting in the way. As Selena carefully took a drink from the tray, spouting hollow apologies towards the woman, she made her decision:
11322133211.title: Another noble demands Selena's service, ref...

choices: A peasant, for some unspecified crime.
A loudmouthed adventurer who has talked poorly about the wrong people.
A criminal, something of a rival to Selena herself.
113222.content: Hm. The target hardly seemed worth the effort of hiring her, but Selena wasn't complaining. Someone really wanted their reputation ruined, even if their reputation didn't reach as far as some of her past targets. For her generous fee, Selena would be tracking down...
113222.title: The target is a stranger to Selena. (Non-Nobility)

1142.content:
And whose adventures shall we follow in Nuderia?

The Duchess of LargeBosomness, a very attractive brunette in her early thirties, who runs a very profitable trading empire from her spacious home?

The Kala of WeAllGoTopless, a dark skinned, long dark haired beauty in her twenties who leads a tribe of nomads on the fringe of civilization?

Lady Sylvia, the young, blonde very innocent eighteen year old daughter of the Earl of Keepembuttoned, who has been cloistered all her life?

or

Lady Sonja, the fiery buxom redhead warrior who has renounced her title as Margraviness of Keepemhome to seek out a life as an adventuress?
1142.title: Female

1151.content:
The human royal family of Nuderia were an odd sort. Like any royal family, their sense of familial pride and loyalty ran deep, as did their natural sense of human modesty. And yet, despite the posh life, the relative lack of responsibility until adulthood, and the riches, there was some dissent among the members of the family. At the very least, a few young males of the family were finding themselves in an odd spot.

Prince Rodrick has recently come of 21 years of age, and in the eyes of the aristocracy, is long overdue on finding a bride. Tall, lean, and handsome, he's attracted more than a few offers, even from non-human kingdoms, though for whatever reason none of them have seemed right to him. Between the pressure from his family, the frightening prospect of a diplomatic marriage, and the unwanted responsibility of ruling in general, Rodrick is finding his loyalty to his kin and kingdom shaken.

His 3 years younger brother, Prince Callum feels similarly stifled behind castle walls, though unlike his older brother, he still gets away with most anything, and has little to worry about in life. His mind is a curious one, however, and he dreams of being allowed to roam free through the kingdom, no retainers or royal responsibilities fast enough catch him. The odds of him surviving outside the castle are somewhat skewed; while he does mean well, he is spoiled, though not quite rotten, meaning that his naivety can get the better of him at times. Not to mention, while he is an attractive young man, his is a body that hasn't known a day of work. Still, its his wits that let him get away with so much inside his family's castle, it's likely they'd serve him well on the outside as well.

Their older brother, however, Prince Dalton, is nearing his time on the throne, with his father's health ailing - nothing deadly, but enough to convince him that his time is better spent relaxing and recuperating, and leave the troubles of the modern kingdom in the hands of a younger, more modern mind. However, while the King trusts his son dearly, he isn't quite ready to abdicate his throne. Dalton, be it through diplomacy, or great achievement in battle, is looking to prove himself to his father. His heart is true, but is single-minded devotion to his task might cause some problems to blindside him, especially considering not everyone approves of his headstrong nature.

Who will the victim be?
1151.title: Male

1152.content:
Royalty, the highest rung of the social ladder in any human nation. Members of the royal family are educated, pampered, wealthy, and respected. The word of a royal is law, and image is everything. No proper noble would dare be caught in anything other than exquisite garments of the highest quality and value, lest their vassal lords or the common peasants think less of them. Indeed, being caught naked might be one of the worst things that could possibly happen to a member of a royal family.

Three royal human women are destined to learn this fact the hard way.

Princess Arianne, the epitome of a proper royal lady. Educated in all the ways of etiquette and politics, Arianne possesses a sharp mind and looks befitting a woman of her station. Long golden hair compliments her clear blue eyes and flawless pale skin, while her well-maintained figure is clad in gowns and dresses that would put any other woman to shame. After all, one must be the spitting image of royal perfection when they are the heir to the throne.

Princess Sharon, on the other hand, is the opposite. A mere two years younger than Arianne, the nineteen year old princess chafes under the expectations placed upon her. Dresses feel awkward, and diplomacy seems boring and pointless. Far better to wear armor and settle matters with a sword, so far as Sharon is concerned. Thanks to some "persuading" of the captain of the guard, Sharon has learned how to handle a sword, and has started to fancy herself an adventurer. All she needs is a chance to slip away from the palace so she can prove herself...

Queen Melody, mother to the princesses above, is a blend of her two daughters. Just as skilled with her wits as with an army, the Queen holds her realm together through shrewd political maneuvering and shows of force when necessary. While she is generally respected and loved by her people, there are plenty of scheming nobles and disgruntled peasants that see her as everything wrong with the land. Any sign of weakness from a queen is dangerous, and could be exploited by her enemies...

Now, who is the unlucky lady?
1152.title: Female

choices: Arianne's carriage is attacked by brigands.
Arriane's carriage comes across a mage with a grudge against the royal family.
11521.content:
Princess Arianne was the epitome of a proper royal lady. Educated in all the ways of etiquette and politics, Arianne possessed a sharp mind and looks befitting a woman of her station. Long golden hair complimented her clear blue eyes and flawless pale skin, while her well-maintained figure was clad in gowns and dresses that would put any other woman to shame.

She was also an utter snob. In her view, peasants were dirt beneath her perfectly pedicured feet, and those who would waste their time on things like adventuring and outdoors activity were little better. Even other members of the nobility were barely worthy of the royalty's presence, and should consider themselves lucky that she would grace them with her presence.

Case in point, as she was currently in her carriage, on her way back to her parents' palace from her private country home by the seaside. While she would have preferred to stay there and lazily spend the rest of the summer, her parents were hosting a gala for some visiting diplomat or another, and her presence was required. After all, she couldn't very well leave matters of royal presence and diplomacy to her sister, who so vulgarly acted as though she was a man in a woman's body. Honestly, Arianne was the only real princess in this kingdom, and she'd be sure to show it off at the gala.

Sadly for her, Arianne would never reach her destination, as her carriage was about to run across an unexpected and unpleasant surprise...
11521.title: Princess Arianne

choices: A once respected Wizard, publicly disgraced by the Queen.
A high elf Sorceress, with a vendetta against the human kingdom.
A Druid, angry about how the kingdom has harmed and 'forgotten' nature.
115212.content:
Vain as she could be, Arianne wasn't totally oblivious. The carriage, as expensively well maintained as it was, still rumbled as it moved, especially on the dirt roads between major settlements. So, when the rumbling stopped, Arianne's frowning began. She gave it a few moments to resume, but her patience could only stretch so much.

It's bad enough that I have to come home at all, she thought, if I have to leave my summer retreat I shouldn't have to tarry on the way to the palace.

"What is the delay?" She shouted, and she knocked on the wall of the carriage between her and the driver. She heard him scuffling away from his seat along its side. A second later, the door opened, and a flustered servant poked his head in.

"I-I'm sorry, Your Majesty, there's a--"

"Repent!" came a shout from behind him.

"... there's a disturbance, out on the road."

Arianne scoffed, and pushed her head out of the carriage, her driver almost slipping onto the road as she brushed him aside. She glanced to the front of her ride, and glared at the lone figure standing there. Arianne had seen mages before, of course, with her parents having a handful of court wizards. Of course, she wasn't so knowledgeable to identify the figure standing before her, or why she should have taken a kinder tone...
115212.title: Arriane's carriage comes across a mage with...

choices: Arianne found herself alone and naked in the middle of the forest.
1152123.content:
Arianne couldn't help but wrinkle her nose in disgust at the man standing before her. The old man's gray hair and beard were wild and filthy, full of leaves, sticks, and dirt. More dirt covered his body from head to bare feet, and he was only wearing a loose robe of hemp, which was showing off far too much as he waved around a tree branch with symbols into it.

"Ah!" he announced when he saw her, "One of rapists of nature themselves!"

"I beg your pardon?" Arianne demanded, "Who are you to speak to a member of the royal family?"

"I am Alric Greenroot," the man stated, "Humble servant of Mother Nature and all her children, something you would know nothing about."

"Oh, a Druid," Arianne said, even more disgust entering her voice, "I should have known by the smell. One can usually tell one of you savages is coming from a mile away."

"You call me a savage?" Greenroot snarled, "It is you so called royals who are the savages! You tear down forests and destroy their beauty to build palaces for your vanity, hunt defenseless animals for sport, and tear open the earth to take its wealth for yourselves! You have no respect for the world around you!"

"You are the one with no respect," Arianne spat, "A peasant like you has no right to speak to your betters like this, and you shall pay for wasting my valuable time. Guards! Seize this madman!"

"No, it is you who shall pay for your crimes," Greenroot replied with calm fury. As Arianne's armed escort began approaching the old man, the symbols carved into his makeshift staff began to glow, and he slammed it to the ground, unleashing a blinding flash of light.

When the light cleared...
1152123.title: A Druid, angry about how the kingdom has harmed...

choices: Arianne tries to find the road
Arianne hides in the woods but finds she isn't as alone as she thought
11521231.content:
Arianne rubbed her eyes. What had that meddling druid done? As the spots cleared she saw she was somewhere else. She'd been teleported! Instead of on the road with her carriage and escort she was in the middle of the forest, surrounded by tall dark trees. She could see nothing through the thick forest, no landmarks at all. Even if she had Arianne had studied a map, or traveled much. She was lost without much hope of finding her way.

Arianne figured that the druid wouldn't have sent her far. Most teleportation spells only had a several mile radius. If she could find her way back to the road she could find her escort. She'd make her guards beat that stupid druid for his prank! That would show the buffoon for inconveniencing royalty!

Arianne shivered. She felt strangely cold despite it being such a warm day. She could feel the wind on her almost as though... no, it couldn't be! Mortified, she slowly looked down. There was her bare body! She was naked!

"AAAHH!" Arianne screamed. She was totally bare. White, pure flesh totally exposed! She was NAKED! She threw her hands over herself, one clamped over her medium sized orbs, hiding her nipples, the other wedged over her crotch. She slammed her knees shut. NAKED! In public! A royal woman's greatest nightmare! All dignity and finery gone! Fully vulnerable, fully exposed! All her secrets revealed. Oh she felt faint! She couldn't go to the road now!

For several minutes she just fidgeted, looking around in every direction, switching her covering hands and panicking. Then, she slowly realized she had to do something! There was more clothing in her carriage. She'd have to be seen... naked! by her escorts and guards to get to it. Could she live with the shame? Her only other option was to stay in the woods. At least no one would see her here, unless she encountered a hunter or some such person. She imagined the Druid was probably nearby. If he found her she could convince him or threaten him into giving her back her clothes!

Which would she choose? Go try to find the road or try to hide in the forest?
11521231.title: Arianne found herself alone and naked in the mi...

choices: Arianne finds the road! But are her guards there or someone else?
Arianne gets lost and has more misadventure's in the forest.
115212311.content:
Arianne had to find the road. She had no survival skills, she'd never even been in a forest before! She didn't know what to do without servants to boss around. Plus, there could be wolves out here! Even worse, there could be unnatural creatures! She felt a tinge of fear as she looked around the dark woods. Yes, she had to get back to the road at once! But which way?

Arianne wasn't used to questioning herself. But she had no clue what to do. Finally, growling with impatience she chose a random direction and started off. As soon as she took a step she moaned. Her bare feet were touching the cold, dirty ground! There were pine needles and leaves. Such things might not affect a normal person, but Arianne barely ever walked, and was only barefoot in her own castle, with it's rugs and smooth floors. Her tender feet were totally unprepared for the outside world. She moaned, walking gingerly on her tip toes, covering her body as best she could. Goosebumps rose from her flesh. It wasn't that cold but it would be night in just a few hours. What would the naked princess do then? She hurried on her tip toes, shuffling awkwardly.

Soon the forest grew thicker. Arianne had to weave her way through low hanging branches. Her was caught by some snaring branches. She moaned as her scalp was yanked. Then, once she'd freed herself she stumbled into a puddle.

"OH EEEWW..." Arianne moaned, feeling the black gooey mud between her toes. She stepped from the puddle. Her feet were now covered in muck up to the middle of her perfect shins.

"I hate the forest!" She huffed. "After my guards beat that druid I'll have them burn this forest to ashes, and force the druid to watch!" She said angrily to herself. "That'll show him!"

She kept tromping, feeling an intense urgency to find her guards...
115212311.title: Arianne tries to find the road

choices: Arianne runs into some thorny vines and things get worse
Arianne finds a stream to wash the mud off.
1152123112.content:
On and on Arianne wandered. She trudged with no grace, stumbling about. Her hair kept getting caught by branches, now it was a frazzled mess around her head. Her royal makeup was smeared down her face. Her white perfect skin was covered in light scrapes, mud and dirt. To a normal person this would be a vague annoyance. To royalty it was torture though! Her perfect skin shouldn't be exposed to the elements like this! She needed her gowns, her britches and robes and jewlery. Instead she was bare, exposed to the harsh world. She hated it!.
