"Barbarians!" The lead paladin cried out, her companions falling into formation beside her, shields lowered and swords at the ready.

"Wait!" Sharon yelled out, ignoring how her breasts bounced around when she raised her arm to get their attention. "We are the Band of Nature's Own, we too seek the end of the necromancer!"

The paladins looked amongst themselves, debating whether or not to believe them, while Sharon's companions drew their weapons, but did not get into battle formation. Trusting their newest member to resolve this issue peacefully.

"Very well," the lead Paladin sighed, the others sheathing their swords. "Then since we have a common goal, let's not interfere with the other, and let the gods determine who shall receive the tower."

Luth nodded, "Very well. Fair thee well on this battlefield fellow adventurers." The paladins ignored him and walked off, continuing their journey without the naked heroes.

Sharon was a little lost, not quite getting what was with all the suspicious glances where the paladins disappeared through the brush. "Are you rivals with them?" Sharon asked, "I mean we."

Jogoshib sighed, running her fingers through her mane of dreadlocks, "It's more theological than simple competition. Worshippers and followers of Textilia believe that the body and nature must be hidden and controlled, where Naturisme says that the body and nature must be free so do as they please." She laughed bitterly. "You can say we were made to be enemies."

Sharon nodded, and the four continued on their way, double checking to ensure that they weren't followed by the paladins, eventually they came up on a cowpen. Looking around, Sharon couldn't see any clear way around it, and that mean the only way to continue was to go over almost ten acres of clear, open fields. "Gwynned," Luth asked, looking back, "do you see any tracks in the fields?"

Gwynned inched forward, Sharon tried to ignore how her breasts swayed and her butt jiggled with each step, and looked around the field. "I see no tracks, but we best make our run quickly, lest we run into hidden scouts."

The group nodded and Sharon gripped her staff as tight as possible, before sprinting across the field with all her might, trying to keep up with her more seasoned companions. Living the life of a princess wasn't physically demanding, and she was a bit soft compared to Gwynned or Jogoshib...especially Jogoshib, that she-orc was built like a solid wall of muscle.

Once safely nestled on the other side in the bushes, they checked the surrounding areas, north would send them through a veritable maze of houses, but it would be quicker to the necromancers tower. While west would take them through the open markets, more of a roundabout way to get to the tower, but reduced odds of an ambush.
11522112211121.title: Go around the long way (stealth)

choices: They get to the paladins safely
115221122111212.content:
The band decided that with the paladins also fairly close to the tower as well, they should take the risk of the maze of houses, and try to take the tower as quickly as possible. To Sharon, this was eerie, just row upon row of empty houses, with only the background din of battle the only other noise aside from their footsteps.

Jogoshib was taking point now instead of Luth since she'd be more likely to turn an ambush around if she was up front. As they walked through the streets, they did spy a group of skeletons around a street corner, and Sharon stepped up to do her thing. Willing nature to act, she watched as seaweed from the nearby river reached out and ensnared the skeletons, dragging them back down into the waters below.

Then everything went south from there.

From every building it seemed that the undead were pouring out, jogoshib and Gwynned were able to fend them off, giving breathing room to Luth and Sharon who needed it to perform their duties in the party. Sharon was scared, she could see the amount of undead that they'd attracted the attention of, and there was no way that the four of them would be able to fend them off forever.

Bit there was a flash of silver at the back of the undead, something cutting its way through the zombies and skeletons, "Luth!" Sharon cried out, "Who is there, at the back of this horde?" pointing to the sliver mess cutting its way through the rotted corpses.

Looking over, luth recognized the silver, "It's the paladins of Textilia!" He called out, "Jogo, Gwyn, work our way toward the east!"

The two melee fighters of their party nodded, and began to carve a way through the mob of undead to the paladins.
115221122111212.title: Through the houses

choices: The parties get separated by group
1152211221112122.content:
"Hail paladins!" Luth called out as the two parties formed a defensive circle, succeeding in holding the undead at bay, "What say you to an alliance?" Luth asked the captain of the paladins.

The captain, for her part, looked at Luth and the other nudist heroes and sneered, "You naked degenerates need to be dealt with, but the necromancer is the threat here. I will allow such an alliance, but only to the completion of this quest."

Luth nodded, smiling, "I wouldn't have it any other way."

The captain didn't respond, and began barking out orders to her paladins, "Begin the push! The Band shall support our flanks!"

Luth got Jogoshib and Gwynned into position on either side of the main battle line, while he and Sharon began to support the group with long range attacks. It was slow going, but Sharon eventually found a rhythm to the battle, cast spell, breathe, new target, repeat. So long as the rhythm remained constant, she was sure that she'd be able to keep this up for a time, as spell casting wasn't physically draining, or if it was, she hadn't hit her limit just yet.

The grind was slow, but eventually they succeeded at pushing their way through the streets block by bloody block, until they got to the base of the necromancers tower. While the paladins rested up and after Sharon had cast healing spells or made healing salve, whichever was required, Sharon looked up at the imposing structure.

A tower of obsidian black, devoid of any marks on its sides, nor any patterns carved into its surface, the tower stood as a massive blot on the countryside. Sharon began to feel anger a time the necromancer for creating such a thing, and wished to tear it down and allow many trees to replace it, and the village around it. "Where did that's come from?" Sharon asked herself, sure the tower needed to be dealt with, but the villagers did nothing wrong. "Maybe it's just the stress from the whole ordeal getting to me." Sharon decided, fiddling with her scarf.

When the larger party was assembled and ready to enter the tower, Luth and the captain stood in front of the party and spoke to them. "As part of the prize for this quest was the tower itself, and only one party can truly succeed the quest," the captain began.

"Then we have decided that the party who's member lands the killing blow on the necromancer shall be the victorious party." Luth concluded.

Everyone nodded, showing their consent and readiness to compete in a potentially lethal final duel. Sharon gripped her staff tight as they enter the dark halls of the tower, and prepared for the toughest challenge of her new career yet...
1152211221112122.title: They get to the paladins safely

11522112211121222.content:
Once everyone was inside, the doors slammed shut behind them by unknown magics, and the next thing Sharon knew, she felt like she was falling and flying up in the air at the same time. When she finally felt solid ground under her feet, she willed her branch to blossom, and many glowing seeds began to drift around the area, illuminating a dark hall, with many bones scattered on the ground.

Hearing a groan behind her, she turned quickly, and saw it was one of the paladins! Running up to her, Sharon saw that she was fine, if a bit dazed and disoriented.

"Where are we?" She asked as she rubbed her head.

Sharon looked around, shrugging, "I don't know. There aren't any windows or any other way to tell if we moved up or down the tower." Listening to the still silence around them, she added, "We also seem to be the only ones on this floor."

Groaning, the paladin stood up, making sure her sword was still with her, as her shield was lost during the transit to their new location. "If we are to be companions, even temporarily, then introductions are in order." The paladin bowed, "I am Ashley, of house Neiad. And you?"

Sharon bowed, temporarily forgetting that she was supposed to be keeping her royal lineage a secret, not realizing that's her bow was the one used by royalty. "I am Sharon...of no house." She smiled at Ashley, "Pleased to meet you."

Ashley noticed the royal bow, but decided not to press the issue, and looked around the area, still lit up by the floating seeds, "I see only two possible ways out, and both seem to curve left or right." She pointed to both directions, "I hope we have stairs at the end of either."

Sharon nodded, feeling a bit more naked now that she was the only one not wearing clothes now, rather than having a group of similar undress to normalize it. She pointed off to one of the halls saying..
11522112211121222.title: The parties get separated randomly

115221122111212222.content:
The two female adventurers began their trek down the right hall, moving slowly and keeping their eyes open for any undead or other enemies that would do them harm. The glowing plant seeds that floated around them illuminated the area well, showcasing the dead that lined the halls, former adventurers, soldiers, prisoners, all lined the hall.

"Poor people, to end in such a way..." Sharon said to herself, muttering a silent prayer to Naturisme for protection.

Ashely simply rolled her shoulders and pressed onward, "If we don't want to be like them, we should keep moving." As they rounded a final turn, they saw a staircase leading up the tower, but it was protected.

Looking at the glowing green cube, Sharon saw that it was ten feet by ten feet all around, and it's sickly green glow made it look very unappealing in the dim light. "What is that?" Sharon asked.

"A jelly slime." Ashley said, her voice filled with venom at merely mentioning its name.

"How do we defeat it?" Sharon asked, trying to look for any weakness.

Ashley sighed, "You can't. They're stationary and immobile, but it's in the perfect center of the hall, we can squeeze through on either side, but anything non-organic will be destroyed by simply touching it." To showcase this, she tossed a rock at it, watching as the rock stuck to the the jelly and slowly disappeared.

"Non organic," Sharon said, "so things like clothes and weapons?"

Ashley nodded grimly, "Yes."

Sharon began walking toward the jelly and began to inch her way between the wall and the jelly, her breasts pushing into the jelly as she inched her way down. Once she was on the other side, Sharon waved to Ashley, "Come on! We should be able to find armor for you over here somewhere!"

Ashley briefly considered just going the other way, but there was no telling how dangerous the other way would be without Sharon to provide light with her primitive magics. Sighing, she began to inch her way between the jelly and the wall, watching as her breastplate slowly dissolved, her under shirt and bra following suit. But before she was even halfway, she needed up tripping and falling, landing awkwardly on her belly, she watched as her backside got eaten away as well.

Wanting to retain some armor, Ashley scrambled forward, and once free of contact with the jelly, took stock for what armor was left. Her cape had somehow survived, though it was now far to narrow to wrap around herself, and as for her armor, her pauldrons and full arm armor had survived, her upper torso section of armor had also (somewhat), survived, but now it wasn't nothing but a triangle that did nothing to hide either breast, and her leg armor from the knees down was all that remained.

https://raikou1.donmai.us/3a/1b/__knight...

"Well I hope we find more armor elsewhere," Ashley grumbled, glad that at least her sword was still usable, "otherwise my captains going to kill me for this happening again."

"What do you mean, again?" Sharon asked, but didn't get an answer, and she hurried to catch up to Ashley, not wanting to be left alone. And so our two naked heroines ascended up to the next level, what was the next floor?
115221122111212222.title: Let's go right!

choices: What other spells do you have?
1152211221112122221.content:
Ascending the stairs, the two found a wide open circular room, lit only by a single, massive crystal hanging from the ceiling which was glowing a bright blue light over the room. On the other side, Sharon and Ashley saw a single doorway, and a large winged statue standing in the center.

"Sharon," Ashley whispered, "we've got to be careful here, that's a gargoyle. A level three boss."

Sharon nodded and readied her staff, "You lead, I'll provide ranged support."

Rolling her shoulders, Ashley held her sword in a double handed grip and advanced slowly toward the gargoyle, really wishing that she still had her armor, or at least something to cover up with.

As they approached the gargoyle, its head suddenly snapped up, its eyes glowing a bright orange, and its stone body's cracked and chipped as it stood up, clearly an ancient monster. "I have been asleep for over a hundred years, and never before have I seen such fashion on heroes."

Ashley blushed as it said this, but didn't say anything, deciding to just attack it and hope to catch it off guard. "Sharon! Entangle!" She yelled as she charged the gargoyle.

Sharon pointed he staff a the the monster and willed roots to burst from the few weeds growing in the corners of the room, watching as they wrapped around it. Only to watch as it snapped the roots off like they weren't even there.

"Only a level 2 Druid?" The gargoyle laughed as he smacked Ashley aside, "And a level 3 paladin, how the class of heroes have fallen."

Ashley quickly stood up and got in a defensive stance with her sword, Sharon running over behind her and performing a minor healing spell. "What do we do Ashley?" Sharon asked.
1152211221112122221.title: Miniboss

choices: It was Luth and Jogo!  They were wounded!
11522112211121222212.content:
"What's your full spell list?" Ashley asked without taking her eyes off the gargoyle.

"Heal, ensnare, bind." Sharon said after reaching out to the spells she could 'feel' in the recesses of her soul. But at the look of astonishment Ashely was shooting her, she blushed, "I am only a level 2..."

Ashley shook her head, "Nevermind, I've got an idea!" She started to circle the gargoyle, "Ensnare when I say so."

Nodding, Sharon readied her staff and waited. Ashley carefully inched her way around the gargoyle, and then charged. "NOW!"

Reaching out, Sharon caused the roots to once again wrap themselves around the gargoyles legs, and Ashley threw her sword up above him, the gargoyle was too focused to realize that the sword was going to cut the chain holding up the crystal.

***CLANG***

The sword flew through the ancient chain, and the crystal crashed down on the gargoyle just as he was about to advance on Ashley. Sharon and Ashley moved forward to the fallen enemy, Ashely grabbed her fallen sword and severed the gargoyles head cleanly from his shoulders. Immediately the exit door opened, and the two naked heroines looked at each other and started to laugh, releasing all the stress from the battle.

"That was a good plan." Sharon said, bending over to get a second wind and try to steady her breathing.

"Well, it was the only thing I could think of." Ashley stated as she watched the exit, making sure that no enemies were coming through the door before they'd were ready when they heard several rapid footsteps heading toward them!
11522112211121222212.title: What other spells do you have?

choices: Ashley's party are traitors, siding with the necromancer
115221122111212222121.content:
From the doorway emerged a wounded Luth and Jogo!

"What happened?" Sharon cried as she rush forward to support the wounded she-orc, easing her down to the ground as Luth answered.

"Goblins. Lots of them." He looked back at the dark hall they'd emerged from. "Gwynned didn't make it."

Sharon nearly fumbled her healing spell on heating that. Gwynned seemed so much stronger than any of them, at least in spirit since Jogo was physically the strongest, and to hear of an adventurers fall so quickly. It certainly changed her view on this whole adevtunring business.

"And what's of my comrades?" Ashley asked, looking very concerned for Jogo, fearing that her company had fallen without her.

Luth shrugged, refletching several arrows from his quiver as he answered her, "We weren't partnered with them after we entered. You two must've been the only ones separated." He pointed up at the ceiling, and Sharon and Ashley noticed several unnatural sounds coming from the brickwork above. "We think that's where the necromancer is, the next floor up. If we get there and kill him, his army dies with him."

Ashley nodded, but was unsatisfied, hoping for more information on her comrades.

"Well," Sharon said as her healing spell finished its work, Jogo standing up and stretching, testing the repaired muscles and bones, "all done, ready to move out when you are." She gestured forward with her staff, eager to end this adventure before anyone else lost their lives.

"Then let's head onward, shall we?" Ashley said impatiently, the three surviving members of the Band of Natures Own following after her, knowing that's there was safety in numbers.
115221122111212222121.title: It was Luth and Jogo!  They were wounded!

12.content:
Majestic and beautiful...good choice

Peasant/commoner: An ordinary shmo living their life in a harsh world

Adventurer: A wandering hero who serves the land as they see fit

Criminal thief, murder, you live outside the law.

Noble A higher-ranking rich fellow

Royalty King, Queen, prince, or princess...the choice is yours
12.title: Elf

1222.content:
Jordana, an elf ranger, has struck off on her own to find fame and fortune in the world. She's a master with a bow and also lighting quick with her daggers. She never had the patience to learn the magic of her people, so she must relies on her physical skills. Nimble and acrobatic Jordana wears leather trouser tucked into high boots, a flowing white shirt with her quiver strapped over her chest, and a cap which she tucks her long, auburn hair under to keep it out of the way.

Meldona is a successful and powerful mage, on a quest to track down relics of great power. She raids temple, dungeons and tombs to find these objects and increase her knowledge and power. Her relic stealing ways have made her the enemy of many peoples all around the globe, but her driving quest for magical superiority makes her not care about the thoughts of others. Snow pale with raven dark hair Meldona wears a traditional wizard's robe, concealing her whole body.

Wella was the apprentice of a powerful wizard. One day the young Elf girl accidentally spilled a goblet of wine on the wizard's spell-book. Enraged, the wizard put a powerful hex on Wella. Now she is cursed with bad luck. Problems and troubles follow her everywhere, and nothing seems to go her way. Years of constant misadventures has made her a wanderer, unable to stay in one place long before the hex brought trouble to her. A beautiful young redhead, she wore a standard traveling tunic, woolen britches and a heavy haversack with all her worldly possessions.
1222.title: Female

choices: Meldona is seen by the natives who guard the temple!
Meldona is caught in a trap!
12222.content:
At last Meldona had found it. After weeks of trekking through these cursed jungles she now found herself standing at the base of the great temple of Uguan. Uguan was once a mighty nation, but had been mysteriously wiped out eons ago. All that was left was ruins such as these, buried deep in overgrown jungles.

In an ancient tome, Meldona had found the location of this temple, which was said to contain an ancient and incredibly valuable relic. She had foraged for weeks, trudging through the jungle and avoiding the locals until she had found it. she now stood before the ancient pyramid, which stood well above the surrounding trees. Meldona rubbed her palms together excitedly, imagining the relic that was now practically in her sight. Now she just had to get past whatever guards and booby-traps lay in the temple, find her way to the relic and get out with her skin (and everything else!) still attached. No problem for a powerful mage such as herself, she thought confidently.

Meldona cast a spell of invisibility on herself. She know would be unseen for 20 minutes. As long as she remained quiet she should make it fine... She set off, leaving the jungle towards the large entrance, which was quite dark and foreboding...
12222.title: Meldona the relic hunting wizard

choices: Meldona tries to fight with her magics
122221.content:
Meldona stood at the edge of the jungle. Beyond this a small clearing. From there rose the temple, a dark and ancient structure. She scanned the temple. There were great stairs leading up to the entrance, a large opening. In front of it stood two guards. On each side they stood, looking down out over the jungle. She studied them. Your normal savages, wearing loincloths, carrying spears of wood and stone. No threat to a mage of her caliber. Besides, they wouldn't even see her!

So, Meldona left her hiding spot, and marched brazenly towards the entrance of the temple. She walked carefully and quietly, yet made no effort to hide. What did she have to fear? She was invisible for the next 20 minutes! As long as she did not foolishly make a ruckus they would not hear her coming.

To Meldona's shock, she walked about twenty paces and both men turned to look at her. She froze. Had see been heard. No, they were looking right at her! And that was when she saw it. Around each of their necks they wore a ward stone. A powerful item which prevented any enchantment or mystical deceit. How had these savages gotten their hands on such powerful magics! Her invisibility was useless!

One of the men raised a horn to his lips. Before Meldona could react he blew a loud bellow which echoed through the jungle. For a second all was still. then, To Meldona's shock, warriors emerged from the jungle. Spear carrying men, all coming straight at her. In a second she was encircled by a sea of spear-points. She'd been caught like an amateur, not even making it to the temple and it's treasures!
122221.title: Meldona is seen by the natives who guard the te...

choices: Meldona is taken to the natives new leader, a rival wizard she knows
Meldona is stripped more and prepared for a ritual.
1222212.content:
Meldona threw her hands up in surrender. She had no chance of getting a spell off before one of these spears found it's way to her. Besides, all these tribal people were wearing powerful protective wards. She wasn't sure if any of them could be the target of spells or abilities. So, she surrendered, cursing herself for being caught unaware by savages!

Quickly two powerful warriors came up and gasped each of her shoulders. She was pushed forward towards the temple. The whole company followed, chanting in a strange language. Melodona was pushed forward, stumbling to keep up. While she walked, hands darted forward. One stole her amulet necklace. Another tore a potion from her belt. Then, to her shock, a hand ripped her belt away, causing her robes to bellow outwards.

"Unhand me!" Melodona screamed in shock. She was ignored though. As she was pushed forward hands began tearing at her robe. Meldona gasped in shock. Her sleeve was ripped, then the hem torn to the knee. She struggled helplessly as he clothes were shredded from her body. Within seconds she was stripped to her corset, bloomers and boots. Her pale white skin stood out in the crowd of darkened natives. Helplessly Meldona was pushed by the crowd into the temple, and whatever unknown dangers waited inside.
1222212.title: Meldona is quickly captured.

choices: She is sacrificed to their god, a powerful legendary human
She is sacrificed to a monster, the lord of the jungle to be it's plaything!
12222122.content:
In the tunnel there was almost no lighting. Besides the occasional flickering torch Meldona couldn't see at all. She was still pushed forward by unseen hands. They still yanked and pulled at her. Meldona pushed them away, but they were unseen and felt endless, coming from all directions as she stumbled along in the dark.

She felt the string of her corset drawn away. She held it to herself but hands yanked it from her torso. She could feel the stale air on her now bare breasts. She hugged her arms over herself in shock.

"Heretics! Release me!" She screamed. Still, she was pushed along. Hands pulled at her bloomers. She gasped, clasping the hem with one hand. The hands yanked down, pulling the bloomers to her feet.

"AHH!" Meldona yelped as she fell to the stone floor, her legs tangled. The unheeding figures around her grasped her arms and lifted her up. She was now being dragged on-wards. She yelped helplessly as her bloomers were pulled off, along with her boots.

She was naked! The exposure felt so extreme, even in this darkened tunnel. In less then a minute she'd gone from a treasure hunting mage, in her element to a naked woman being dragged through the dark by strangers! She couldn't cover herself, each arm being held. She couldn't even gain her footing, her bare feet sliding over smoothed stone.

Suddenly something was draped over her waist. Something cold and hard encompassed her hips. Then, something over was wrapped over her chest. She gasped as the same cold material encased her breasts.

Then, all of the sudden they burst forth into daylight. Meldona blinked, blinded by the bright sunlight. Unseeing she was dragged farther. Then she felt cold heavy steel clink around her wrists. She looked through the spots that danced in her vision. Her arms were in manacles! Each was chained, pulling her arms wide apart. Then, two more natives grasped her ankles and pulled them wide.Her ankles were chained as well, forcing her to stand wide.

Meldona looked around. They were on the top of the pyramid, a large flat area. Thousands of natives were gathered, all chanting. she was above them all on a raised platform. Then she looked down.

Meldona gasped. They had dressed her like some jungle queen! She had a metal bikini around her chest, which barely covered her perky pale mounds. Below that she was bare except a metal chain link belt around her waist, which had two flimsy pieces of fabric off it to hide her butt and crotch! She pulled on the chains, wishing she could cover her pale, skinny body.

She looked nothing like the woman who'd entered the tunnel. The wise, robbed mage was gone. Instead it was a bikini clad woman, pale and skinny, surrounded by bronze and muscular people. Her black hair was a messy birds next around her head. Her cheeks were bright red from excretion and embarrassment. Her knees shook as the people looked on.

Meldona could guess what this was. Some sort of primitive sacrifice without a doubt. She'd seen such things before, though she'd never been the one being sacrificed! The question was, what was she being sacrificed to?
12222122.title: Meldona is stripped more and prepared for a rit...

choices: He makes Meldona a servant to his people
122221221.content:
The native began chanting louder. They moved together, hands raised, looking to the sky. Meldona just wiggled her chains, wondering how she was going to get out of this mess. Then, suddenly, a beam of light shot down from the sky. The beam illumated the platform in a blue glow. Meldona was mesmerized as the natives all bowed.

Meldona looked up. There was a small dot above her. Slowly it became a figure above her. Winged. It lowered down until they touched to the ground directly before Meldona. It was a male, clad in golden armor. On his back was a sword, impossibly large, bigger then most men. And he had wings. White feathery wings. His face was dark skinned and angular and his eyes glowed blue.

"Uguan!" Meldona exclaimed. The legendary leader of the lost people. Meldona recognized him of course. She'd come here to steal his treasure, after all! But what did he need with treasure anyway? He had ascended to a higher realm thousands of years ago! The last thing Meldona had expected was that he still led these people!

"What's this?" He said, looking towards Meldona. His voice crackled with energy, almost like thunder. "Another thief, here to steal my earthly horde? All that remains of my empire?"

"No, of course not!" Meldona exclaimed.

"Lie not to me, woman!" Uguan yelled, with such force Meldona's hair was swept back. Her legs shook with fear. She wished she was facing this man of legend as a fellow mage, instead of chained and dressed like some hut dwelling savage!

"Uguan has no patience for thieves. Or for you pale skinned easterners who don't respect my descendants." He gestured at the gathered people. "The question is, what do with you?"
122221221.title: She is sacrificed to their god, a powerful lege...

1222212211.content:
"I have a fitting punishment for you, thief!" Uguan exclaimed. "You shall serve my people! You will be the lowest caste. Below any man, woman or child or animal. A permanent slave to make their lives easier!"

He turned to his people. He spoke in their language for a moment, then they all erupted in a cheer.

"Wait, please!" Meldona whined fearfully. Normally she feared nothing, but this man was practically a god! Besides, she was a high born mage! She couldn't be a servant to a bunch of savages!

"I sense some small amount of magic in you." Uguan addressed her once again. "And so, I lock that power away inside you, beyond your use until you learn true humility!"

He pointed a finger at Meldona. She felt a sudden draining, as though she was instantly becoming exhausted. She fell to her knees, struggling for breath.

"It is done! You are helpless!" Uguan exclaimed. "Now, you shall serve my people wearing...."
1222212211.title: He makes Meldona a servant to his people

choices: Bustling city, in the midst of a celebration.
12223.content:
"Look, I know I have money somewhere, please--"

"No money, no room."

"I swear, I have money, just... give me a second to find it--"

"You've had more than enough time. No money, no room."

And with that, the door to the inn slammed shut in the redheaded Elf's face. Not as distraught as one might expect, Wella was used to things like this, and slumped down with her bag, leaning against the wall next to the door.

"Of all.... the rotten.... goddamn...." Wella muttered to herself, hands traveling through pack and pockets alike in search of gold that she was sure she had stashed away.... and being met with a hole in her left pocket as an answer. "Great." she said simply, to no one in particular. "Just... great."

Hands coming to prop up her chin, Wella groaned in frustration. Old Erasmus, her bastard former mentor, had cursed her long ago over a spilled bit of fine on what was probably not even that expensive of a spell book! At the very least, he seemed able to cast curses just fine without it, because ever since that day she'd had terrible luck, just like the wizard swore she would. And even though it'd been a while since then, it could still get her down sometimes. Case in point, the hole in her pocket. Definitely not the worst damage her clothes had endured, but it'd cost her some much needed gold pieces and a comfortable night's rest.

The location wasn't too bad though. She was going to need to find a place to eat and sleep, one way or another, so it was a shame she didn't really have time to take things in, but she really did like this...
12223.title: Wella, the bumbling wanderer.

choices: An important looking noble, whose path she walked into.
A contest being announced in the town square.
Someone handing out beads to a group of women.
122232.content:
Wella didn't even know who or what this big party was for, but it looked like a great time! The streets were lined with stalls selling strange and sparkly wares, with scores of people traveling which ever way between them. Most of them were just travelers or citizens, like Wella herself, but some of them were performers! Jugglers, stilt-walkers, magicians practicing both real and stage magic. All framed by bright banners and signs, discount drink and fancy costumes galore!

125222122222222.content: When the giant saw that Charmful, he smiled and emerged from the lake. Charmful saw that the giant was nude, aroused and
125222122222222.title: with the giant bathing in the lake

choices: jump in front of the giant and confront him
1252222.content:
Prince(ss) Charmful watched in awe as a handsome male giant strode across a clearing. The giant was so tall that, if he were normal size, Prince(ss) Charmful would have only been a foot tall in comparison.

The handsome male giant seemed oblivious to Charmful''s presence The giant was about to disappear into the forest, so Charmful decided to
1252222.title: a foot tall

choices: wander off and contemplate this strange matter
125223.content:
We pick up our story of Prince(ss) Charmful leaving his horse behind to climb a rocky trail in search of a dragon.

Charmful is carefully ascending the trail, when she turns a corner and finds herself face to face with a huge, copper colored dragon!

She draws her sword but the dragon is prepared for her, and easily knocks it out of her hand. The armored Charmful finds herself pinned to a cliff wall by one of the dragon's claws, unable to do anything but squirm.

"This is very curious indeed," the copper dragon says, studying and sniffing Charmful. "You have the look of warrior, sworn to kill me and my kind, and so I am almost honor bound to kill you in return. Or at least find out if you're trying to kill me in particular, or just any dragon whose path you cross. On the other hand, you have the smell of a princess, and a virgin one at that. My evil cousins find virgin princesses a true culinary delight, whereas I, being good, am honor bound to take all virgin princesses I come across into my care, for their own protection. You have the look of one, but the smell of the other. Curiouser and curiouser."

The copper dragon, clearly perplexed, decides to
125223.title: a dragon

125224.content:
The tree ents of Nuderia are similar to the ents of other worlds. They are very large, growing to heights of sixty feet or greater. They are considered the shepherds of the forest. They are strong, tough, long-lived and patient.

They are also very curious about the world around them, very perceptive and, when it comes to females of the humanoid species of Nuderia, sometimes just a little perverted.

Nuderian tree ents look like giant trees with humanoid features, covered by fuzzy vines of varying thickness. The vines in question are actually part of the tree ents bodies, and are sturdy and versatile.

A tree end named Murray was walking across a meadow when he sees a young armored knight(Prince(ss) Charmful sitting a few yards away from their horse, sharpening their sword.

It's not the first time Murray has seen a knight, and he's even aided a few on their quests. He might normally have been tempted to aid this one, but Murray was on a quest of his own. Still, there was something about this knight that caught Murray's attention.

Murray decides to
125224.title: a tree ent

13.content:
Brutal and Sexually charged.

Peasant/commoner: An ordinary shmo living their life in a harsh world

Adventurer: A wandering hero who serves the land as they see fit

Criminal thief, murder, you live outside the law.

Noble A higher-ranking rich fellow

Royalty King, Queen, prince, or princess...the choice is yours
13.title: Orc

1322.content:
Orcs of any gender are suited to battle, their large size, combat-focused culture, and natural ferocity making them quite adept at it. The green Amazonian women among the Orcs were no different.

Kalka is a paragon among Orcs. Big, dominant both in battle and the bedroom, and bare, the little leather that covers her skin is there to secure her massive axe and any gold she may acquire. Those who think to cross her beware; she's not likely to let infractions slide, and men and women of all races have found themselves bared and beaten under her full frontal assault.

Ragni is another Orc woman, also very big, very strong, and very prone to nudity. Unlike Kalka, she restrains herself enough to cover her more private parts. Not out of any sense of modesty, but for the sake of her traveling companions. The dwarven cleric, in her stuffy robes, demanded it out of modesty. The elven rogue was fine if Ragni wanted to go uncovered, but had to admit that she'd rather Ragni have some sort of protection against damage. And the scrawny human mage; he'd never confront Ragni over it, but she noticed how long it took him to cast spells while standing behind her when said behind was bare. No, she'd grown attached to her ragtag group, and if it kept them from falling apart in battle, she'd put in at least a bit of effort to cover herself. Not that they didn't still have clashes over this cultural difference...

Nara, by comparison, keeps herself covered to a human standard of modesty. A runt by Orc standards, the nonetheless large woman would rather stay in her leather armor than run around in a loincloth, or less. Still, what she lacked in brute strength and size, she made up for in ingenuity and tactical knowledge. A big, green fish out of water among both Orcs and Humans, she was quite protective of her modesty.
1322.title: Female

1342.content:
In the scorched deserts of Nuderia lived the vicious, yet oddly sensual, orcs of Firebush. Whether named so for the extreme heat that would set any bush alight or for some other purpose, it is unknown.

The social ranks of the Orcs are based on prowess outside of the immediate royal bloodline, which must be descended from the first champion of the Orcs, but all other nobility is is earned in battle prowess. Unlike other civilizations, the inspiring tale of the peasant to general isn't so strange, it's actually common; if you're strong enough, you might even challenge the king.

Some basics on Orcish society is it is well male dominated, but there are protections for the female sort as well. Women of the Orcs are powerful, able to fell many of the mightiest humans, but even their strength pales in comparison to their male counterparts with arms thick as tree trunks. The structure usually goes that the man runs the household, and the politics thereof, and to show subserviance to their husbands, the wife is to remain nude and be "marked", a laceration across the lower back similar to what might call the stamp of a whore, but fear not as it is a sign of respect. Males must win wives, strip them of their cloth, and then be able to force his name onto her.

This is the story of Gramia, an Orcess challenged countless times for her breeding, and has never lost so much as a scrap of cloth. She is a powerful general, one many would like to over power to claim as theirs, but until that day, and even after (albeit remaining nude), she is widely respected. Her attributes are a full head of hair, crimson as the blood she's drawn from countless foes and suitors, a dark skin blazoned by the sun that despite it's battletested state, has an unnatural smoothness to it. She lumbers over most female Orcs, similar in height to the males, large breasts, even for the legendary mammaries of the Orcs. Underneath is a mystery, as I've stated before, none have seen her disrobed but from the way her tunic, emblazoned with countless symbols marking her bravery. The top it all off, she's quite young, only the age of 26 and having bested Great Warlords several decades more experienced.

What is the fair Orc's quest in this land?
1342.title: Female

13421.content:
Yes, the dream of every young Orc. To attain such strength you might challenge the Royal family. It's seen a damned near impossible, as the Monarch of these lands has been alive for centuries, and ruling harshly for as long of a time.

The rumor of Orcs being short lived is both true and false, as yes, they often die young, but if they can not be slain in battle, they will continue on, growing in depravity and power.

For the young Orc, she was called crazy, as many have gone, Heros of old, all manner of Orc, even a queer human or elf has sought the crown, but none have been heard from again. Gramia was hopeful though, as she was one of the most powerful Orcs in the land, and she faced stale competition from the local city. She aspired to at the least challenge the Monarch, and in the process face many daunting task.

There are many ways to challenge the castle, and all have been tried. What would Gramia do?
13421.title: Regicide

13422.content:
Despite her demanding and overpowering nature, Gramia would like nothing more than to start a family. With her power, and with a male stronger than her, a powerful clan could be born.

She won't simply accept any male though. He must, as the tradition go, defeat her, strip her, and mark her. She will accept no man who can not do this.

There are countless suitors that call upon her, almost daily, but today, a strange creature beckoned her and caught her offguard. Something about this being caught seemed to imprint itself on her mind. Who was it?
13422.title: Marriage

134222.content:
Trickery comes in many forms. Is the person a rogue, who will attempt to trick her from her clothes and do it in discretion?

Or will it be a powerful mage come to capture a powerful (and nude) familiar by abusing Orcish rite?
134222.title: Tricky Human

14.content: There are many other peoples of Nuderia. Some are rare and mystical, some are hated or feared. All will play a role in the tales to come...
14.title: Other

141.content:
This is the thing you need to know about gnomes.

Gnomes are not like dwarves, except this, or halflings except that, or humans, but something else, or elves, just with...

Well, you get the picture. Gnomes are like gnomes. Period. And they will kick your ass if you don't agree to that right off the bat. Because gnomes don't fight fair, and they don't fight in anything but groups. Remember that.

And never, ever, ever mention those garden statues, travel commercials or movies in their presence. That's another way to get your ass kicked.

The average male gnome (or at least the variety that lives in Nuderia) stands about eleven and half inches tall, with the average female gnome standing ten and a half inches high. They are a very attractive people, with hair, eye and skin color running the range that humans do. Except it's best to say that human coloration runs the same range as gnome coloration does. Or you get your ass kicked by a group of gnomes.

Gnome society can be best described as controlled anarchy. They're all amazing inventors, subterranean farmers (Nuderian gnomes live in rabbit-like warrens, but again, don't describe it that way to them) and much sought after jewel-smiths. Dwarves especially will seek out gnomes to help them convert their precious metals and gemstones into amazing creations.

Gnomes tend to were sturdy leather outfits, with lots of belts and pockets to carry their inventions in.

Our story begins as we follow a gnomish inventor who happens to be
141.title: Gnome

142.content:
Demon born are the most hated people of Nuderia. Descended from the creatures of darkness, they can easily be recognized by their horns and tails. Some even have red skin, wings or cloven feet. Though their personalities vary a great deal their purpose on this earth is to spread suffering to and misery to feed their ancestors in hell.

Often they have pale skin, jet black hair and narrow, tall features. A proud people, they wear exotic clothing such a corsets, leather pants, flowing dark jackets, and other such wicked looking clothing. They rarely mingle with the other races of Nuderia, for they are hated by almost all others. They have powerful magics born of their dark energies.

This tale will follow...
142.title: Demon Born

choices: Lilith, a wicked Demonborn who loves to expose others
Magdeth, a young demon born trapped in a human city
Sandrth, a rouge demon born who wants to do good in the  world
1422.content: There are many different types of demon born. Who do you choose to join on their journey
1422.title: A female born

choices: Sandrth looses her hat, the crowd seeing her horns.
A Ceslestial senses her demon blood and confronts her.
14223.content:
Sandrth had always been an outcast amongst her people. For one thing, her demon side barely showed. She didn't have glowing red eyes, scales or wings. In fact, if it wasn't for her small horns and forked tail, she could easily be mistaken for a human. She was tall, narrow framed with snow white skin and shocking red lips. Her hair was raven black and straight. She had a more modest fashion sense then the average demon born, wearing a tunic, leggings, tall boots.

Her people didn't accept her. Not just because of her appearance, her morality was the real issue. Sandrth was a good person. Kind, thoughtful and caring. This went against every belief of the demon born, who vauled rage, cunning and wickedness above all other traits. Eventually, unable to reconcile these differences, Sandth had left her people. She traveled in secret among the human world, trying to find a way to do good. At the moment she was in the city of Grollo, a bustling metropolis She wore a hat to hide her horns, and had her tail uncomfortably wrapped under her skirts. She had never been to a city. She looked around at the different people in amazement. Little did she know she was about to be revealed as a Demon Born, the enemy of all other races!
14223.title: Sandrth, a rouge demon born who wants to do goo...

choices: Sandrth stays to try to talk her way out of this
142232.content:
Suddenly the hairs on the back of Sandrth's neck stood up. She slowly turned. There, lowering from the sky was Celestial. The angelic figure slowly lowered to the ground on it's magnificent feathered wings. This one was a woman, close to six feet tall, narrow in frame, with blonde hair and skin so fair it looked like the sun never touched her. She wore the standard white robe of her people, with a belt around it and a sheathed sword hanging from that. Besides her sandals all she wore besides was a bejeweled necklace.

The crowded city street made room for the angel to land. Some stared at her in amazement. Some looked annoyed at the presence of the goody goody Celestial. Others stared at the perfect woman with unbridled lust.

Sandtrh, on the other hand, stared in complete terror. Celestials were the natural enemies of her people, the Demon Born. They had a sense for each other. Any minute now the Celestial would sense Sandrth's presence, then the concealed Demon Born would be in a great deal of trouble, for Demon Born were the enemy of all other races. No one ever cared that Sandrth was a kind hearted Demon Born, they just saw her horns and forked tail and wanted her dead or imprisoned. Every time her identity had been discovered she'd had to flee.

Sandtrh began walking away. Maybe is she got far enough the Celestial wouldn't feel her presence. It was too late though. The blonde woman Suddenly looked in Sandrth's direction. Sandrth looked over her shoulder, obviously sneaking away. The Angelic woman's eyes narrowed. Then she drew her sword, causing the crowd to fall back in fear. She pointed her sword straight towards the frightened Sandrth.

"You there! Halt!" She commanded. For a moment Sandrth stood frozen, not sure what to do. Then...
142232.title: A Celestial senses her demon blood and confron...

choices: Mardina uses her wings to blow a gust of wind at Sandrth
1422322.content:
Sandrth turned back to the Angelic woman menacing her with a sword. The crowd between the two cleared away, not wanting to get in the way of the blade. Sandrth put on her best innocent expression.

"Who, me?" She asked in mock surprise. She knew with the Hat on to hide her horns and her tail hidden in her beneath her tunic she looked just like any other peasant. The Celestial could sense her demonic side but no one else could.

"Yes you!" The Celestial said, staring down her elegant nose at Sandrth. "Reveal yourself foul demon spawn and face divine justice!"

"Uh, I think you're confused." Sandrth said, putting a innocent quiver on her voice. "P...please don't hurt me..." She cowered in false fear, looking as pathetic as possible. The crowd started to grumble in annoyance at the Celestial.

"Must be some mistake." Someone said.

"She's just a wee lass! Leave her be!" A dwarf said, shaking his head.

"Damn Celestial, threatening an innocent like that!" An old man said in disapproval, spitting at the angelic woman's feet.

The Celestial, Mardina, looked around. She saw the crowd was growing angry with her. If she did not show this Demon Born for what it was soon, there would be a full riot on her hands! She glared at Sandrth, who shot her a defiant smirk before once again looking frightened and innocent. Mardina felt cold rage at the other woman's mockery...
1422322.title: Sandrth stays to try to talk her way out of this

choices: ...Blew up her skirt, showing her tail!
...Knocked her hat away, showing her horns
14223221.content: Suddenly Mardina had an idea. A way to show the crowd what Sandrth really was. She pulled back her mighty wings, then swung them together, creating a mighty gust of wind that blew directly at Sadrth. The demon born squealed in shock as the strong winds hit her, kicking up dust. The winds also...
14223221.title: Mardina uses her wings to blow a gust of wind a...

choices: Sandrth unleashes a mild blast of fire, singeing everyone around
142232211.content:
Mardina needed to act. The crowd was becoming unruly, and that cursed Demon Blood was going to get away. Suddenly, she had an idea. A way to show everyone what this Demon Blood really was. She flapped her wings, pointing a gust directly at Sadrth. It blasted through the crowd, kicking up dust and causing an uproar. The sharp wind cut straight at Sardth, who turned in shock, just as she was blasted by wind.

Sadth gasped as a strong updraft blasted against her. To her shock and utter horror her clothes, including tunic, were blown straight up! This revealed her tail and a lot, lot more. Due to the fact that all Demon Blood had tails, they couldn't wear conventional undergarments. Since Sandrth was wearing human clothes she hadn't been able to find any bloomers which fit comfortably over her tail. So, she had decided not to wear any, assuming no one would ever know.

Well now, not only did everyone now see her tail, they also could see her narrow, pale white butt, hips and crotch! Sandrth struggled to pull her tunic down, wind pushing it up around her chest. She looked in utter horror at her exposed crotch, white bony hips leading down to a thick mound of jet black hair. Blushing mightily (her embarrassment was even more embarrassing because it was considered weak for a Demon Blood to show shame) She finally managed to pull the front of her skirt down, though everything else was exposed. Her tail, her white butt. Her leggings stopped mid thigh, above that nothing but flesh.

The crowd pointed in shock.

"The Celestial was right!" An old man yelled. "She got a tail!"

"One of those cursed demon lovers!" A crone yelled.

"Look at her butt!" A little boy laughed.

The crowd started circling around Sandrth, yelling, on the verge of a riot. The Celestial was coming, sword drawn. She felt panic building up in her. What could she do? As a Demon Born she possessed powerful dark magic, but she was no fighter. But, what could she do but unleash her magic or run? She saw no other choice. She had to do something before this mob turned ugly...
142232211.title: ...Blew up her skirt, showing her tail!

choices: Dive into an alleyway, hope the Celestial has trouble in the narrow space.
Run through the marketplace, move fast and lose them in a bigger crowd.
Panic,and duck into a nearby door.
1422322112.content:
Demon Born as she was, and as much as she might have liked the idea of pulling one over on the Celestial, Sandrth didn't want to hurt anyone- if she were to use her fire magic, she'd be more worried that she'd hit them too hard rather than not hard enough. So, not being able to threaten them away, and unable to take the Celestial in a fight, Sandrth did the one thing she could do.

She ran.

There was an old man behind her, reflexes slow even despite his anger, and she managed to shove passed him. He managed to get a glancing hit in at her head- it didn't actually hit her, but she felt her hat come loose and fall away, rendering her incapable of hiding her horns. The Celestial took to the sky as the crowd surged after her, wing beats kicking up Sandrth's tunic as she ran, giving the mob peeks of her tail and backside as they followed after her.

Sandrth managed to react quick enough that she'd gotten a head start, but the Celestial was high above her now, waiting for a moment to swoop down. Sandrth knew she had to react fast...
1422322112.title: Sandrth runs away!

143.content:
The Fairy Folk! Folktales tell of Fairy Courts, deep within dense forests and woods, where these flying little bundles of magic dance, sing, and be merry. Of course, nothing makes a fairy happier than messing with someone bigger than them; pretty much anyone in Nuderia is fair game for a magical trick, a suspicious bit of bad luck, or a sudden embarrassing infliction. Of course, different fairies have different abilities, some stronger than others. Some faeries are wild, and freely fly about with all their technicolor skin on display. Some are more modest and more human looking, fashioning clothes out of leaves or small bits of cloth. The latter are at a disadvantage when caught; they have modesty to aim for when being punished.

Male or Female Fairy?
143.title: Fairy Folk

1432.content:
As was said above, there are different types of faeries, each more marvelous than the next. Or, at least, that's how they view themselves anyway. So we have four fairy lasses whose story we can follow:

Danish Blossom: Danish Blossom's people might have been one of those that Shakespeare had written about in his Midsummer play. Normally, they go about at six inches tall, though they can assume human size when they wish. They like to play small tricks from time to time on human folk, but mostly they like the Big People, as they call humans. They're very magical, but it is possible to capture one of Danish Blossom's people, if you make the right preparations and keep your wits about you. But get just one thing wrong, and you will soon seriously regret having made the attempt. It's better to appeal to their appetites for sweets and their vanity, if you want them to do something.

In a number of ways, the faerie people to whom Danish Blossom belonged to mirrored that of human society. And, except for their gossamer wings (which they could make appear and disappear at will) and the fact they stood only six inches high, they very much resembled human beings, save they were more lovely to gaze upon. Their society has peasants to grow things, artisans to build things, traders to trade things, and nobles to rule things. All of them clothed themselves, though what they clothed themselves in depended on where they stood in society. Peasants, for instance, clothed themselves in plant parts, though they might use actual cloth for special occasions. Nobles, on the other hand, always wore at least cloth, regardless of the menial task at hand. And as far as special occasions were concerned, they wore clothes magically woven from rainbows and moonbeams and dewdrops and other such things.

Danish herself is from a minor noble family, that had recently elevated themselves up from the traders' class. So it was a point of honor with them that their daughter never wore anything but cloth, and that her dresses were the most glamorous at any ball.

And as a warning to the reader, if you were to capture one of Danish's people, it would be best to make it one of the nobles. As a point of honor, a nobleman or noblewoman who found themselves caught will try to get out of it by themselves. But if you were to capture a poor peasant fairy lass, you'd have her whole clan to contend with. Or as the saying goes, a fairy in the hand means ten in the bush.

Yelp -- although human mages who conduct the taxonomy of magical creatures would classify Yelp's people as fairies, her own kind would fight to your death against being classified as such. For one thing, Yelp's people aren't bright and light. They're not dark, by any means. They're just sort of...not dirty, but earthy. Yelp dresses like most of her kind with a brown tunic, brown pants, brown boots, brown socks, brown cap...you're getting the picture, I trust?

Yelp stands about six inches tall, has no wings, can't fly, but can jump in such a way that you think she's flying. She has brown hair, brown eyes and light olive skin. She can talk to animals and convince most of them to do her bidding, save foxes or cats. Foxes have learned a long time ago, however, not to cross Yelp and her kind, and give them a wide berth. Cats usually do as well, though once in a while they try to see if they can get the upper hand. They never do.

Yelp's people can appear and disappear at will, and have other tricks. For the most part, they like people, but mostly if they can watch them from afar. They do love butter, though, and a good butter cookie with a little milk is heaven on earth to them

Diagalilly -- Diagalilly's people are six inches tall and have skins that come in many colors, from those seen on the skins of other beings, to bright oranges, deep blues and such. Their hair and wings (which appear as butterfly wings, and which they can make appear and disappear at will) are always colors that complement their skin color. They are curious about humans, but only from a distance. Very little is known about them or their 'powers', as it has been discovered to be very dangerous indeed to try to capture one. The great mage Doratimus once recorded four hundred years ago that when his colleague Jusexumus managed to capture one of Diagalilly's people, "It was as if the whole world moved as one and turned against him. He found himself assaulted by both the natural world and the magical one until, out of desperation, he released the captured fairy and begged forgiveness."

Hera Dawnfollower -- Scholars debate whether it is proper to classify Hera's people as fairies or not. Although they stand six inches tall and have wings (which they can make appear and disappear at will), their wings resemble those of birds, rather than insects.. Indeed, Hera's people are not thought to have very many innate powers, like most fairies do. They are, however, considered more clever than the gnomes. Much more clever. Hera's people are known to come from beyond Nuderia, though where exactly they come from, and how they travel to Nuderia, no one exactly knows. In some ways it's easier to capture one of Hera's people than other fairies. If you do, however, you should know, that as far as Hera's people are concerned, there are no rules in recapturing one of their own. And make no mistake, Hera's people are deadly. They are fast and nimble and carry rapiers on their belt that, for all their small size, wield strange powers and are thus quite deadly. In addition, they carry other objects on their belt and about their person which most would prefer never to have demonstrated on them.

Hera's people have been traveling to and from Nuderia for at least three hundred years now, and have established enclaves in a handful of coastal cities. They are renowned for the jewelry they offer, though here is the thing. They rarely, if ever, want to trade for material objects. They might pass up a trade for several bars of gold, for instance, but accept a painting. But they especially like a good song or story. A song they find praiseworthy might be reward with a human sized ruby ring, for instance, that is so finally crafted it would be worth to embrace a queen's finger.

The stranger who thinks about abducting a member of Hera's race should remember that the cities in which their enclaves exist will not appreciate someone trying to steal the goose that lays the golden egg.

As far as dress is concerned, the men and women of Hera's people dress alike. Sturdy trousers and jackets made of some unknown material, shirts of a single bright color, sturdy boots, and a belt with the previously mentioned rapier and other objects on it. Objects that only respond to the touch of one of Hera's people.

So which six inch lass shall we follow?
1432.title: Female

144.content:
Descended from the gods in the heavens, the Celestia's live on earth to spread peace and prosperity. Tall, thin people, they all have a faint aura of light around them at all times. Clad in robes with feathered wings, all Celestial are tall, thin and angelic in appearance. They work amongst the other races of Nuderia, though many Celestial believe themselves to be far above such petty creatures, and are arrogant and aloof.

Always clad in flowing white robes, garnished with jewels, their magics come from heaven, healing and nurturing. They are bitter enemies of the Demonborn.

What sort of Celestial will this story follow
144.title: Celestial

145.content:
Dwarves, a sturdy, practical people, are known for three things: First, the innate knowledge they seem to have in matters concerning stone and metal work. Secondly, the seriousness they regard their work with. Thirdly, expressed most often after a hard day's work, the dwarves' love of strong drink. Strong, short, stout and sturdy, the dwarves are noted for being one of the few races to have a species-wide sense of modesty on par with that of humans.

Goblins, wild little troublemakers that live on the fringes of society. Some regard them as cousins to the orcs, though the similarity ends with their green skin and frequent lack of attire. Goblins often delight in causing havoc, sneaking into smaller settlements to, at their nicest, play humiliating pranks on the people within. Not all of them stay wild, however, though the ones that don't are few and far between. Such goblins, those who have traded their loincloths for more modest garments, often face hardship due to their kin's reputation and their small stature.
145.title: Other

1451.content:
There are two big misconceptions when it comes to dwarves: there are no females, and they all are the same with minor differences culturally, like humans. This is false. There are in fact three 'main' culture groups that a dwarf will belong to, depending on the region. Female dwarves do, in fact have beards, just not on their faces.

The first are the Ironbeards, wearing scale-mail and plate armor, these dwarves are fond of Warhammers and sturdy fortresses. They never forgive a grudge unless they have repaid it seven times over, or if the offending party agrees to right the wrong, and then serve the dwarf for as long as they see fit. But if you should gain their loyalty, there is no better ally to have. They are in constant odds with the elves, believing that the body is something that only should be shared between spouses, and even then, with at least three remaining undergarments on both parties for modesties sake. They are most often found along mountain passses and rivers, their massive fortresses evident on the rock face.

Second, the Firebrands, with bright orange and red hair, favoring the axe as their weapon, they use magic gold to carve runes into their skin, allowing them to forgo conventional armor and go fairly undressed. Usually all they will wear is their beard. Unlike the Ironbeards, the Firebrands shave their heads into massive Mohawks, rather than elaborate braids. The thickness and color of the beard is the pride of any good Firebrand, and damaging it is seen as a great shame. They are most often found around volcanoes, their magma being rich in metals already liquidated for forging.

Finally, the Coldstone, who are only found atop the coldest peaks, these dwarves are dark skinned, unlike their cousins, and rarely come down from their mountain homes. Aside from the fact that none of them have beards, nor has a male been seen, few if any know anything about their culture...

Which are you from?
1451.title: Dwarves

14512.content:
So, our main character is a Firebrand, living in the volcano fortress their clan was from. But there is a very important question: is the hero male, or female?

Remember, while male dwarves have beards, the females do not, at least, not on their faces. You should be able to figure out where.

The beards and 'beards' are braided to show other dwarves what the individuals rank in society is, whether they are married, and their chosen craft. Just a cultural note.
14512.title: The Firebrands

1453.content:
Simbara, tribal cat people looking much like Cheetahs living out on the central steppes of Nuderia, they are famous for their exotic spices, herbs, and dyes that they make out in the wild lands. They are not fighters by nature, preferring to use intellect and guile to walk away victorious, and are the most bestail of all the races, able to run on all fours as well as two. In terms of clothing, they either wear nothing, or very little, their fur providing most protection that they need, otherwise they put on loincloths when dealing with outsiders if they demand it. Because their lands are metal poor, most of their weapons are either made from bone or stone, and any metal ones are traded for.

Primals are humans who rejected the birth of civilization, forced to the craggy mountains and badlands by the other races, they are not animals, just more in touch with the way things used to be. Before the new gods ruled, and nature wasn't a malevolent and destructive force keeping the races in check. Fire and stone-knapping are the most advanced technologies amongst them, for nature provides for them all they'd require and more. Their eyes can see in the dark, they have empathy with animals, not quite talking to them, but not quite controlling them either, more agile, stronger and faster than their human kin too. They wear nothing but anklets, necklaces, bracelets, and occasionally body paint.

Teliqonae are the gangsters of the world, skink-people out by the forests and coasts, they deal with the traders and serve as interpreters and negotiators for various parties and companies. They are merchants and businessesmen at heart, willing to trade anything to come out on top. One notable example is when a clan leader traded his daughter to secure a new trade deal within the human demesne. They don't wear clothing so much as decorations and fancy scarfs and wraps across their body, and don't have a concept of indecency. They often have their servants, regardless of race, dress in the same way or wear even less to retain control over them through embarrassment.
1453.title: Other

info.brief_description: Nude times in the olden days.
info.description:
In times of old, great kings ruled, magic was wielded, across the land all kinds of species (both sentient and not) roamed the land, and there were a lot of naked people.
Wait, what?

Naked Fantasy Life takes place in the realm of Nuderia (original I know). You take the role of a peasant, noble, hero or anything in between within one of the many kingdoms of the land as they go through many naked-related adventures, weather it be intention or not.

there are three races to start, with more potentially being added (explained bellow)

Humans Humans of Nuderia are spread all across the land and, like most fantasy humans strong willed, brave, and come in a variety of personalities. Most human civilizations view nudity as shameful and practice modesty, believing the human form to be weak and vulnerable. But there are still a few who embrace their natural form.

Orcs of Nuderia live in the scorched desert, unlike most counterparts aren't raving ugly brutes. True, they are much large than the other species, standing over eight feet tall, with both genders being naturally muscled, and they are green skinned with a pair of viscous lower fangs...aside from that Orcs are quite appealing and very well endowed. Male Orcs have members that large and thick (anybody under ten inches is considered small), and female orcs have massive breasts that, while odd still remained proportionate to their muscles bodies. Because of this Orcs are known for ferocious sexual appetites, and also tend to toss modesty aside as they believe anyone who willing covers up their sexual gifts to be shameful.

Elves of Nuderia are beautiful, perfect being who occupy the vast forests of the land. Always at one with nature, lower-ranking elves tend to go about naked simply because modesty is something they do not believe in. Higher ranking elves however are taught to wear majestic clothes designed to cover their bodies to the fullest and for an elven noble to shed them in public it is considered improper.

Other races also exist, but I'll let you decide who those are.

Rules
No vore, scat, diapering, anal, BDSM, or other extreme fetishes. Sex is allowed but keep it to the 18+ rating, the same goes for mastrubation.

I reserve the right to delete chapters as I see fit.
